loans.name: José Santos

texts.es:
José, de 41 años de edad, solo estudio hasta sexto grado, ya que su familia no tenia los recursos necesarios para ponerlo a estudiar, está casado y tiene dos hijos, los cuales están estudiando.

José, se dedica a la albañilería, también al servicio de herrero, esto lo aprendió gracias a su padre, el cual se dedicaba a las mismas actividades; trabaja todos los días, su lugar de trabajo es fuera de su comunidad, en ocasiones tiene que viajar muy lejos, todo depende de donde sea el contrato,

El crédito lo necesita para comprar herramientas como pulidoras, martillos y cinceles.

Su mayor sueño es, renovar su casa, hacerla de bloque, ya que actual mente es de barro y también desea que sus hijos estudien y se superen.
texts.en:
José is 41 years old and only studied until the sixth grade because his family did not have the necessary resources to support his studies. He is married and has two children who are both in school.

José makes a living in masonry, along with blacksmith services. He learned this thanks to his father, who made a living in the same activities. He works every day, and his place of work is outside of his community. Sometimes he has to travel far, it all depends on where the contract is.

He needs this credit to buy tools such as grinders, hammers, and chisels.

His biggest dream is to renovate his house, and make it out of blocks as it is now made of mud. He also wants his children to study and succeed.

loans.use: to buy tools such as grinders, hammers, and chisels.

loans.name: Iyet

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Iyet. Iyet lives in Serang, a suburban area located about two hours' drive from Jakarta. She lives there with her husband and her three children (one son and two daughters). She owns a small stall where she sells mobile phone accessories and mobile airtime credits, and provides mobile payment services for her community. Iyet has a personality that is both soft and strong, which is why her customers see her as a trusted mobile provider.

Iyet joined Ruma in 2013. She knew Ruma from a sales executive that came to her stall. With support from Ruma’s staff, Iyet sees some improvements in her business. As the business grows, Iyet is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. Your loan will be very useful to help Iyet improve her business and, accordingly, her community who needs access to such services.

As seen in the photo, Iyet is the one who is sitting and smiling, holding her own child, in her own small stall. She will be thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for her community

loans.name: Wendy Aracely

texts.es:
Wendy, de 31 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos y vive con su madre, es empleada de una agencia telefónica.

Wendy, tiene cinco años de trabajar como empleada de una agencia telefónica, de ese trabajo mantiene a sus tres hijos y ayuda a su madre con los gastos de la casa. 

Wendy, utilizará el crédito para colocar una tienda de paletas en su casa, para obtener una entrada extra de dinero en su hogar. 

Ella desea colocar su negocio y ampliarlo en un futuro.
texts.en:
Wendy is 31 years old. She is a single mother who has three children and lives with her mother. She is employed by a telephone agency.

Wendy has worked for five years as an employee of the telephone agency, and this job maintains her three children and helps her mother with the household expenses.

Wendy will use the loan to place a paleta store in her house, to have an extra income at home.

She wants to create her business and expand it in the future.

loans.use: to place a paleta shop in her house.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.pt:
A senhora  Gloria de 33  anos de idade, casada  e mãe de 3 filhos que frequentam o ensino primário e secundário, respectivamente. Ela  é  trabalhadora numa empresa vocacionada na venda de material de construção, exercendo a função de cozinheira há mais de 05 anos.
Com o presente empréstimo será aplicado para comprar material de construção (cimento, varrões, tijoleira,  pedra, areia para aumentar a sua casa e, tem como grande desafio concluir a sua casa para acomodar os seus filhos e posteriomente adquirir uma viatura para a facilitar nas suas deslocaçoes.
texts.en: Thirty three year old Gloria is a married mother to 3 children who attend primary and secondary school. For more than 5 years, she has been working as a cook for a building materials company. She plans to use this loan to buy building materials, such as cement, building rods, bricks, stone and sand, so that she can build her own home, and her greatest challenge will be finishing this project so that she can provide her children with more space. In the future, she would like to buy a vehicle to help her get around easily.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as cement, building rods, bricks, stone and sand.

loans.name: Unión Y Progreso Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNIÓN Y PROGRESO II” iniciará el vigésimo octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Giovanna es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de frutas secas, venta de accesorios de celulares, venta de carteras de cuero, venta de audífonos, venta de CD’s, venta de bisutería. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Giovanna es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su hermana que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de fruta seca; da a conocer que en su niñez ella ayudaba a su madre a realizar estos productos, con el pasar del tiempo decide invertir sus ahorros en realizar un negocio independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de frutas secas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros  y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución y la atención de la Asesora.
texts.en:
The Unión and Progreso communal bank will begin its 28th cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Juan Pablo II regional center.  It is comprised of eight members and led by a board of directors.  Giovanna is the president.  The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied and include selling dried fruit, selling cell phone accessories, selling leather wallets, selling headphones, selling CD’s, and selling costume jewelry.

The loan that they will take out will benefit people with small businesses where Giovanna is a member.  She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years.  She joined by invitation from her sister, a member of the institution.  She currently has a dried fruit business.  She says that when she was a girl she helped her mother make these products.  As time passed she decided to invest her savings to establish an independent business.

The loan she will now take out is to increase capital (to buy dried fruit wholesale).  She will get the fruit from the vendors in the city of El Alto.  Later she will sell it at her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate earnings in order to support her family financially.  She is in a common-law marriage and has one child.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the savings and the training that the institution offers and the services of the loan officer.

loans.use: to buy dried fruit wholesale.

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.pt:
A senhora  Hortencia tem 43 anos de idade, casada  e mãe de 05 todos frequentam a escola. Para alem dos seus filhos, sustenta a sua nora e seu neto. 
Com o presente empréstimo será aplicado para comprar material de construção como portão para o muro e portas para a casa principal. Ela sonha em um dia ser empresária para poder ajudar  aos necessitados com ajuda dos que têm poupança, tem o desafio de reembolsar o empréstimo dentro do prazo estipulado.
texts.en: Forty three year old Hortencia is a married mother to 5 children who all attend school. Asides from her children, she is also responsible for her daughter-in-law and her grandson. She plans to use this loan to buy building materials such as a gate for the outer wall of her property and doors for the main house. She dreams of being a businesswoman one day so that she can help those in need, using the financial support of those who have money in savings. The greatest challenge that she faces will be repaying this loan within the specified term.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as a gate and doors

loans.name: Filomena

texts.pt:
Senhora Filomena tem 50 anos de idade, é casada e mãe de 6 filhos, dos quais 3 estudam, frenquentando o ensino primário e técnico respectivamente, vive em casa própria com a sua familia, trabalha como segurança de uma empresa privada.
Com o montante financiado vai comprar cimento, areia, varrões, chapas para a renovação da sua casa visto que está em péssimas condições para a habitação.
No futuro espera terminar com a construção da sua casa e colocar mobilia de modo garantir o minimo de conforto para os seu filhos.
Terminar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora é o seu  desafio, de modo a garantir futuros financiamentos na instituição como forma de lograr o mais rápido possίvel os seus projectos.
texts.en: Filomena is a 50 year old married mother to 6 children, 3 of whom are studying either at primary level or in college. She lives in her own home with her family and she works as a security guard for a private company. She plans to use this loan to buy cement, sand, building rods and sheet roofing to renovate her home as it is in a very poor condition. In the future, she hopes to finish the building work and to furnish the house so that her family will be able to live in greater comfort. Paying off this loan without getting into arrears will be the greatest challenge that she has faced, but she is committed to this end as she would like to secure further loans in the future so that she can complete her projects as quickly as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, building rods and sheet roofing to renovate her home as it is in very poor condition.

loans.name: Kea's Group

texts.en:
Kea’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Kea makes a living cultivating rice; she also does extra work by farming and selling cakes. She has one young son in her family.

In the group's village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Essi vit à Apédokoè. Agée de 43 ans et mère de deux enfants, Essi est mariée et cohabite avec son mari dans leur maison. Essi a pour activité la couture des habits qu’elle vend à ses clients. Essi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au grand marché et réalise un bénéfice grâce à cette activité. Pour acheter des rouleaux de tissus, Essi demande ce crédit pour réaliser ses objectifs et accroitre sa rentabilité.
texts.en:
Essi is a 43-year-old, married woman who lives in Apédokoè.  She is mother to two children, and lives with them and her husband in their house.
 
Essi makes and sells clothing for her customers.  She buys her supplies twice a month from the main market, and makes a profit.  This is why she has requested a loan.  She would like to buy further supplies and improve her profit.

loans.use: to buy 11 rolls of fabric for her clothes making business.

loans.name: Naxsoeun's Group

texts.en: Naxsoeun’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Naxsoeun makes a living cultivating rice. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en:
Nhor, 51, lives in a community in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has four children. To make a living and support the family, she manages and operates a farming process, primarily growing rice and selling her agricultural product to local dealers and customers in the market. She has been in this business for 35 years. 

On average, Nhor is able to earn US $3 a day. The farmland that she owns is small and it provides only a small benefit to her. She wants to rent more farmland to grow cassava but she cannot afford to do so. Nhor would like to get a KIVA loan to rent a plot of farmland for growing cassava. She hopes this additional farmland will help to improve her living conditions. Nhor is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to rent a plot of farmland for growing cassava

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr: Ayélé est une femme mariée de 44 ans et vit à Sokpekopé. Mère de quatre enfants elle est dynamique et très entreprenante. Ayélé est une revendeuse de charbons de bois à la devanture de son domicile et trouve considérablement une bonne rentabilité dans son activité. Ayélé s’approvisionne deux fois par mois auprès des fournisseurs du quartier. C’est pour acheter des charbons de bois que Ayélé demande ce prêt afin d’avoir un profit et soutenir les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ayélé is a 44-year-old, married woman who lives in Sokpekopé.  She is mother to four children, and is dynamic and enterprising.  

Ayélé sells charcoal from in front of her house, and finds that this provides her with a good profit.  She buys her supplies twice a month from suppliers in her area.  This is why she has requested a loan.  She would like to buy further supplies, make a good profit and provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy 45 sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
Dilorom is 34 years old, married and has three daughters who are very young. She lives in Khujand town with her family. Her husband is a taxi driver. 

Dilorom is a seamstress. She has three years of experience in it. Her sister also helps her. 

Dilorom wants to support her family. For this she must to increase her activity. She wants to buy fabrics for the sewing of new dresses, as well as thread, buttons, etc. 

In the winter, her husband's income is not good. That's why Dilorom needs to help provide for her family. For this reason she needs Kiva lenders' help.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, thread, buttons, etc., for sewing new dresses

loans.name: Equity Group

texts.en:
Sunita, 32 years old, is a divorcee and the mother of two boys, both attending school. She currently supports her family by running two small services in the same room: a beauty salon and soft drinks sales. Sunita has been in this business for four years, working from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily. She is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

In order to improve her business, Sunita and three other members decided to form a joint group called EQUITY to access financial support. She is now requesting her second loan from Kiva's partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. Sunita used her previous loan, which she repaid successfully, to improve her business by starting to sell soft drinks. She is really happy and proud with Kiva's support. Sunita dreams of expanding her business concept to a high level - managing a big shop selling drinks together with other services such as Mpesa and Tigo pesa. 

Sunita will invest her new loan to buy soft drinks and hairdressing equipment for her salon.She will share this loan with her group consisting of four members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and hairdressing equipment for her salon.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: This is Jamila. She lives in the Vakhsh district and has a small, close-knit family consisting of two sons and one daughter-in-law. Jamila raises livestock. Almost all residents of this area are involved in this kind of business. She buys livestock and fattens them for a few months, then resells the animals at the livestock market. Jamila raises the livestock at home in her yard. She decided to expand her business by increasing her livestock headcount, thus improving her family's living conditions. She hopes to buy livestock for the amount of the loan and believes that she will receive the loan.

loans.use: to buy livestock and expand her business

loans.name: Makoka Group

texts.en:
Zawadi is 36 years old, married and has got three schooling children. She has been supporting her family by running a beauty salon, together with selling cosmetics in the same room. She has been in this service for six years now, working from 7:30 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a good profit each month. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her seventh credit request to be apportioned between Makoka's two group members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Zawadi used the previous loans, paid back successfully, to buy more cosmetics and hair dressing items. After struggling, Zawadi has now improved her business, together with owning land on which she started building a family house. She is a good example for other women. In the coming years, she would like to expand her cosmetics business.
 
With her seventh credit, she will buy hair dressing equipment for her salon and cosmetics to resell.

loans.use: to buy hair dressing equipment for her salon and cosmetics to resell.

loans.name: Ana Corazon

texts.en:
Ana Corazon is 38 years old, married, and has three beautiful children. She has been a wholesaler of banana and root crops like "camote" (sweet potato) in their town for almost nine years. From this long time experience of selling, she already has high knowledge in dealing in this kind of business. Even though there are many competitors in the town, Ana Corazon still gets more customers then the rest due to her good salesmanship and characteristic effort. She has been successful over the years and manages to save more money for her family. 

For now, Ana Corazon is planning to buy a parcel of land in order to manage a new business, which is creating a small pig pen for additional income in the near future. 

To fund this project, she needs additional capital to purchase 200 kilos of banana and root crops for wholesale, so she has requested a loan from Paglaum-MPC.

loans.use: to purchase 200 kilos of banana and root crops to resell.

location.town: Sindangan-Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Lady Myres

texts.en:
Lady Myres is a hardworking mother from Ozamiz. She is 37 years old and a businesswoman who buys and sells milled coconut at the market. She buys whole coconuts for this. 

Lady Myres has signed up her membership with the cooperative to gain access to insurance and credit. She applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts for milling and selling. Lady Myres hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts for milling

loans.name: Rosa Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina, de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está casada y tiene 2 hijos. 

Delfina, se dedicaba a los oficios del hogar, pero actualmente está trabajando como empleada doméstica, su esposo se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol y café.- Delfina, siempre se ha dedicado a lo mismo, aunque en ocasiones ha tenido que trabajar en la finca con su esposo.

El dinero lo necesita para comprarle a sus hijos zapatos y uniformes para que vayan a la escuela. 

El sueño de ella es apoyar a sus hijos, para que sigan estudiando y sean profesionales, también a futuro sueña con tener un negocio, para no tener que trabajar para otras personas.
texts.en:
Delfina is 37 years old, she studied until the third grade, she is married and has two children.

She works looking after the household, but at the moment she is employed as a domestic worker. Her husband grows corn, beans and coffee. Delfina has always done the same work, although on occasions she has had to work on the farm with her husband.

She needs the money to buy her children shoes and uniforms so that they can go to school.

Her dream is to support her children so they can continue studying and become professionals. She also dreams in the future of having a business, so that she doesn't have to work for other people.

loans.use: to buy her children shoes and uniforms so that they can go to school.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is from Clarin. She  joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC so she can avail herself of financial assistance for her chosen business. She has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. 

Recently, she took a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for her chosen business. Helen wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila, 54 years old, lives in Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte, with her husband and three children. Her husband is a carpenter but has no permanent work. Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, she has found ways to attain income through her sari-sari (small grocery) store business. 

She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store in January of 2009. She became a MIGS (member in good standing) member, which is why she has received loans several times already. 

Now, she applies for 10,000 PHP to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari (small grocery) store

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 62 years of age. She has been widowed for 23 years with seven children in Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. In order to meet financial needs in raising her children, she engaged in the fish-vending business. Ester was given an opportunity to rent a stall in the fish market where she displays her fish to sell. She has been in this business for many years already, earning a good return, enabling her to support the needs of her children, four of whom are finished and landed good jobs. 

Since she wants to generate more income, Ester joined Paglaum MPC to gain insurance and financial assistance, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at market. She has now applied for a loan of 3,000 PHP to buy more fish for resale. She is hoping that with Paglaum’s help, she can become a successful vendor someday and eventually a fish stockholder in the public market at nearby towns.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en:
Horn’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Horn makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Haeruman

texts.en:
Haeruman lives in Serang, located about two hour’s drive from Jakarta. He owns a small stall where he sells small snacks and drinks and provides mobile payment services for his community. His community sees him as a trusted, friendly and informative mobile payment service provider.

Haeruman joined Ruma in 2013. He knew Ruma from one of sales executives who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wanted to try another business opportunity, as well as increase his savings and contribute more to his community. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Haeruman sees improvements in his business. 

As the business grows, he is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile payment services for his community. Your loan will be very useful to help Haeruman improve his business and accordingly, his community, which needs access to such services. 

In the photo, Haeruman is standing in front of his small stall, holding Ruma’s banner. He is very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for his community.

loans.name: Ina

texts.en:
Ina lives in East Bandung, a semi-urban area located about three hour's drive from Jakarta. She lives there with her husband and her son. 

She owns a small stall where she sells small snacks and drinks and provides mobile payment services for her community. Ina has a cheerful, kind personality, as well as a strong will to improve her life. Ina joined Ruma in 2013, and this is her second time applying for a loan from Kiva. The previous loan helped her to do more mobile transactions on weekends and she thanks all of the lenders because of it. 

As the business grows, Ina is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. Your loan will be very useful to help Ina improve her business and accordingly, her community, which needs access to such services.

In the photo, Ina is standing in her small stall. She will be thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for her community.

loans.name: Seam's Group

texts.en:
Seam’s group lives in a rural village in a province in Cambodia. Seam makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Sokkhea's Group

texts.en:
Sokkhea’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sokkhea makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a seller to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Pha's Group

texts.en:
Pha’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Pha makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a construction worker to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Eyram

texts.fr: Eyram est une femme mariée et âgée de 32 ans. Eyram vit à Ségbé et mère de trois enfants, elle est dynamique et très entreprenante. Eyram est une revendeuse de perles et parcoure tout le quartier pour l’exposer à ses clients. Elle trouve considérablement une bonne rentabilité dans son activité. Eyram s’approvisionne une fois par mois auprès des fournisseurs du Ghana. Pour commander de nouvelles perles, Eyram demande ce prêt pour financer son achat et avoir un profit et soutenir les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Eyram is a 32-year-old, married woman who lives in Ségbé.  She is mother to three children, and is dynamic and very enterprising.  

Eyram sells bead necklaces and covers her whole district on foot to show them to her customers.  She makes a good profit from her business.  Twice a month she buys her necklaces from Ghanaian suppliers.  

Eyram has requested a loan in order to buy more necklaces.  She expects to make a good profit and provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy 15 lots of bead necklaces for resale.

loans.name: Noun's Group

texts.en:
Noun’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Noun makes a living cultivating rice. She also works as a tailor to earn extra income to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expense,s and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to purchase a water filter to provide safe drinking water

loans.name: 21 De Febrero Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “21 DE FEBRERO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Crecencia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de flores, venta de frutas, venta de ganado porcino, venta de ganado ovino, tienda de barrio, servicio de construcción.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Crecencia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de flores; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años, al trabajar con su amiga quien le enseño la forma de comercialización de estos productos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de flores por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “21 DE FEBRERO” will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Regional Office of Patacamaya. It is made up of nine members and is directed by a board of directors of which Crecencia is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied. Among them exist: flower sales, fruit sales, pork sales, sheep sales, a neighborhood store, and construction services.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small business entrepreneurs of which Crecencia is a member. She indicates that this is the first time that she has joined Pro Mujer, joining through the invitation from a massive promotion from the institution that they performed in her zone. Currently, she has a business selling flowers. She makes it known that she learned this business many years ago while working with her friend who taught her how to commercialize these products.

The loan that she will now take out is for the increase of capital (the purchase of flowers wholesale) that she will acquire from the wholesale sellers in the city of La Paz, and subsequently she will sell them in her commercial space. This form of work allows her to generate an income to support her family economically, since she is single and has a son.

When she is consulted what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase flowers wholesale.

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Vorn, 34 years old, lives in a rural area of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has two children who are currently in school. He is a truck driver and earns, on average, USD 11.50 a day. So far, he has been in this career for five years. 

His wife, Chan Thou, 31, has been a tailor since 2010. On average, she can make an income around USD 6.00 per day. Vorn would like to apply for a Kiva loan via HKL and he is going to use this loan to buy jewelry. He thinks that now the price of gold seems to be low and that it is, thus,  a good time for him to buy jewelry with a low price and keep it for sale when its price increases. He is thankful to all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to buy jewelry.

loans.name: Jancopampa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JANCOPAMPA” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Celia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de repuestos de bicicleta, venta de verduras, venta de papa, venta de leche, servicio de transporte, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Celia es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de quinua; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años, por iniciativa propia al observar la amplia comercialización de este producto decide emprender este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de quinua por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Jancopampa” will begin its third cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Regional Office of Patacamaya. It is made up of eight members and is directed by a board of directors of which Celia is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied. Among these exist: the sale of spare bicycle parts, vegetable sales, potato sales, milk sales, transportation services, and food sales.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small business entrepreneurs of which Celia is a member. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago, joining through the invitation of a massive promotion from the institution that was performed in her zone. Currently, she has a business selling quinoa. She makes it known that she learned this business for many years through her own initiative when she observed the ample commercialization of this product, she launched this business.

The loan that she will now take out is for the increase of capital (to purchase quinoa wholesale) that she will acquire from the wholesale sellers in the city of La Paz, and subsequently she will sell it in her commercial space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she is single.

When she is consulted what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase quinoa wholesale.

loans.name: Nosotras Y El Group

texts.es:
Francisca es una mujer de 49 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 6 hijos independientes, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es emprendedora, buena madre, atenta, amable, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘plan 3000’ caracterizado por la multiculturalidad de sus pobladores provenientes en su mayoría de inmigrantes de occidente y algunas etnias del lugar que emigraron a la ciudad, de clima cálido tropical muy húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-35 grados centígrados.
Francisca es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (sentada la 2 de la izquierda, viste blusa color crema y lleva una cartera en el brazo). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como comerciante, sus hijos son independientes y no viven con ella, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su necesidad por mejorar su negocio la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; comercio de artículos de baño, horneado de masitas típicas, venta de pollo, heladería, venta de ropa de segunda mano y venta de jugos naturales, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocio. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional como; Sopa de Remojado (sopa de huesos), majadito de charque (carne deshidratada, arroz, huevo frito y plátano frito), locro carretero cruceño (sopa de: carne deshidratada, carne cortada en pedacitos, yuca y huevo), labor que realiza todos los días de la semana para la hora de almuerzo y cena, usando 2 sombrillas como techo y un poco más de una docena de sillas. “cocino desde que era niña, cuando tuve mis hijos cocinaba para ellos luego se independizaron e inicié mi negocio de venta de comida, mi negocio prospera y necesita crecer…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un restaurante grande, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de mesas y sillas para poder atender a mayor cantidad de clientes. Esta es la 6 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esas razones que Francisca solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a mayor cantidad de clientes y tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
Francisca is a 49 year old woman who lives with her partner. She has 6 independent children and her business is selling traditional food. She is independent, a good mother, attentive, friendly, responsible and hard-working.

She does her business in the Plan 3000 area which is characterized by the multicultural inhabitants the majority of them being immigrants from the west and a few ethnic groups from the area that moved to the city. It has a hot very humid tropical climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 18 to 35 degrees Celsius.

Francisca is dark-skinned, with long black hair that she wears tied up, dark eyes, is short in stature with a robust physique. Her native language is Guarani that she speaks locally and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for her business. (She is seated second to the left wearing cream colored blouse and with a handbag in her arm).

She shares her life with her partner who works as a businessman. Her children are independent and don't live with her. She lives in her own house made of bricks with a metal roof that has running water, electricity and sewage.

Her need to improve her business led her to form a communal bank with people with businesses like bathroom product sales, baking traditional pastries, selling chicken, an ice-cream shop, selling used clothing and sales of natural juices, to request a loan and expand their businesses.

Her business is selling traditional food like Sopa de Remojado (bone marrow soup), majadito de charque (dried meat with rice, eggs and fried plantain). locro carretero cruceño (soup with dried meat, meat cut in pieces, yucca and egg). She works every day of the week for lunch and supper time using two umbrellas as a roof and a bit more than a dozen chairs. “I have cooked since I was a child. When I had my children I cooked for them. When they grew up I started my business of selling food, my business is prospering and needs to grow” she commented.

Her dream is to have a large restaurant.She wants to expand her business by buying tables and chairs to serve a greater number of clients. This is her 6th loan with the institution in the 3 years she has done this business. For these reasons Francisca is requesting a loan to buy tables and chairs to serve a greater number of clients and have a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to serve more clients and have a restaurant..

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a smallholder dairy farmer from the cold and hilly Litein region of Kenya. Lilian is very passionate about dairy farming because milk is the main source of income for her family. 

Recently, after her dairy cow delivered a calf, Lilian made plans to construct a cowshed to shelter her animals against harsh weather and provide a conducive environment for them to feed and grow healthy. The major setback has been lack of financial resources. It is for that reason that Lilian is seeking a loan to construct a barn. 

Lilian's family will benefit from your investment in multiple ways, but the obvious one is improved health and productivity of their cash cows.

loans.use: to pay for construction of a cowshed.

loans.name: Rufino

texts.en:
Rufina is 47 years old and married with eight children. Three of her children are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rufina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rufina has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream which is to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 45 years old and married with seven children. Four of her children are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Maria is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Maria has been raising pigs for eight years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream which is to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Brigido

texts.es:
Brigido, de 65 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está casado, pero no tiene hijos.

Brigido, se ha dedicado desde hace 20 años a la agricultura y la ganadería, este oficio lo aprendió de su padre y trabaja cerca de su casa.

Brigido, invertirá el crédito para comprar alimento para el ganado y otra parte en insumos agrícolas, con esto obtendrá mejor producción y buenos ingresos.

El sueño de Brigido, es mejorar su vivienda y gozar de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Brigido is 65 years old and studied up to grade 2. He has no children. Brigido has worked for 20 years in agriculture and raising cattle, work he learned from his father. He works close to his house. Brigido will invest the loan in buying feed for his cattle and the other part for agricultural inputs. Brigido's dream is to improve his house and enjoy a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy feed for his cattle and another art for agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal is a hardworking man living in Masindi-Uganda. He is a farmer, which provides him with an income to meet his children's basic needs. He faces a challenge of price fluctuation of agriculture products and the unpredictable weather changes.

Micheal requested a loan, which he will use to weed and buy pesticides. He dreams of educating his children and constructing a house for his family.

loans.use: to weed and buy pesticides.

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Josephat is a hardworking man living in Masindi, Uganda. 

He does farming, mainly growing maize. He also bought a milling machine for grinding maize and this has added to his income. 

He dreams of educating his children and constructing a house for his family. He faces a challenge of fire outbreaks that affect his work and reduce his returns. 

He is a hardworking man who wants a loan to buy spare parts for his grinding machine.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his grinding machine.

loans.name: Pum's Group

texts.en: Pum’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Pum makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace is 30 years old and has six children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Grace has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to the best seed prices and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Grace also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan. She is very excited about the solar light, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Grace's Group will be able to receive a total of eight solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5 acres.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en: Sophal’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sophal makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a food maker to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en: Sophal’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sophal makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farmer and a construction worker to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Everlyne's Group

texts.en:
Everlyne is the group leader of her group in Kakamega North District. She is representing 13 farmers, including herself. She is married and a proud mother of 3 children. Everlyne joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but she has been a farmer for 15 years.

Like many other farmers, Everlyne decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to earn enough to feed her family. She hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer she will get with this loan, she can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers who have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. She plans to use the profits she earns from this year’s harvest to send her children to school.

Everlyne's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of 6 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 8 solar lights, as, even though Everlyne decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Rael's Group

texts.en:
Rael is 32 years old, married, and four children. She is described as a very hardworking individual.  As a group leader, Rael is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Rael's desire to earn enough to feed her family. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

Rael and her group will receive a total of nine solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 4.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Luzmila Stefania

texts.es:
Portoviejo es la capital de la provincia de Manabí en Ecuador. Conocida por ser la primera ciudad ecuatoriana más antigua asentada en la región costanera,  está  ganando terreno en el turismo ya que este cantón posee playa, ciudad y campo.
En este lugar vive la señora Luzmila, tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y no tiene hijos. Su esposo es guardia municipal, viven con familiares.
Doña Luzmila para salir adelante junto a su familia tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa,  ahí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su mamá le ayuda en su trabajo cuando ella puede y está desocupada Tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar cervezas, arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes  y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  hace 2 años y medio,  le gusta el servicio de socio seguro  y las capacitaciones que les da la fundación. Su sueño es ejercer la profesión de Auditoria que está haciendo la tesis y dejarle el negocio de la tienda a su mamá.
texts.en:
Portoviejo is the capital of Manabí province in Ecuador. It is known for being the first and oldest settled city on the coast of Ecuador. 

This region is gaining ground in the area of tourism because it has beach, city, and countryside.

Luzmila lives here, she is 23 years old and married with no children. Her husband works as municipality security. They live with relatives. 

Luzmila supports herself and her family with a store in her home selling basic goods. She sells all sorts of goods here, like rice, sugar, oil, detergents, legumes, vegetables and fruit. Luzmila works everyday from 8am - 8pm, sometimes until even later. Her mother helps her in the store when she is able to. 

Luzmila has had her store for a year and it's going very well. Luzmila will use this loan to stock her store, she will buy beer, rice, sugar, oil, detergents, and other basic products. 

Luzmila has been in the Credit Group for two and a half years, she likes the secure partner service and the trainings the foundation provides.

Her dream is to work in the Auditing profession that she is studying for and leave the store to her mother.

loans.use: to buy beer, rice, sugar, oil, detergents, and other basic products.

loans.name: Idalba Lorena

texts.es:
Portoviejo es la capital de la provincia de Manabí en Ecuador. Conocida por ser la primera ciudad ecuatoriana más antigua asentada en la región costanera,  está  ganando terreno en el turismo ya que este cantón posee playa, ciudad y campo.
En este lugar vive la señora Lorena, tiene 37 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 18 y 9 años los mismos que estudian en cuatro año básico y el otro estudia el tercer año de bachillerato. El cónyuge es comerciante y tiene un local de pizzas.
Doña Lorena es una muy  buena esposa que trata de ayudarle a su esposo con la dura carga del hogar, ella realiza los créditos para que él  utilice en su trabajo, él tiene un local de pizzas, ella le ayuda a su esposo, trabajan de 17h00 a 23h00, también le da trabajo a 7 personas más.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar materiales para la pizzería como embutidos (jamón, salame, chorizos, etc.), bebidas como colas, jugos, etc.  Lleva siete años y es una socia fundadora del  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta la sesión educativa y los beneficios que le ofrece la fundación. Su meta es seguir incrementando el negocio.
texts.en:
Protoviejo is the capital of the Manabí province in Ecuador. Known for being the oldest established city in the coastal region, it is gaining ground in tourism since this canton has a beach, city, and countryside.

In this place lives Lorena. She is 37 years old and maintains an open domestic partnership from which she has two children, 18 and 9 years old, one of which studies in the fourth year of elementary school and the other in the third year of high school. Her spouse is a merchant and has a pizza shop.

Lorena is a very good wife who tries to help her husband with the difficult responsibility of the home. She takes out the loans so that he may use them in his work. He has a pizza shop. She helps her husband. They work from 17:00 until 23:00. They also provide employment to 7 other people.

She will be using this loan to purchase materials for the pizzeria, such as lunchmeat (ham, salami, chorizo, etc.), and drinks such as colas, juices, etc. She has been a member of and is a founding member of the credit group, and she likes the educational sessions and the benefits that the foundation offers. Her goal is to continue growing the business.

loans.use: to purchase lunchmeat and drinks.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses lives in Kasese Uganda. He is aged 39 and a married man with six children. He runs a bar as his main source of income. He also practices farming, growing crops such as maize, cotton, rice and others to get additional income.

Business expansion is his major dream. However he is faced with bad debtors as a challenge. Moses is requesting money to buy spirits and beers to sell.

loans.use: to buy spirits and beers to sell.

loans.name: Dickson's Group

texts.en:
Dickson is 30 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. He has 4 children and is married. As a group leader, Dickson is representing his group of 13 farmers in Kakamega North District in Kenya, and he is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Dickson's desire to have access to the best seed prices. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge his phone. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to buy a cow.

Dickson and his group will receive a total of 13 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 4 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en:
Ghazala is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a 35-year-old woman. She lives with her two children and husband in Lahore, Pakistan.  

Her brother has been running a mobile shop for the past ten years. He sells new mobiles and mobile accessories such as chargers, batteries, hands-free, bluetooth devices, etc, in his shop. 

He speaks with an even tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of his customers. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. Therefore, Ghazala requested a loan, so that her brother would be able to buy more stock of new mobiles as well as accessories such as batteries, chargers, hands-free, and bluetooth devices to increase his business. Due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, Ghazala has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With the help of this loan, her brother would be able to purchase relevant items for his business purposes so that he can earn more profitable income to manage his business and household.

Ghazala is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy mobile accessories for her brother's business

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Samnang is a 26-year-old student who is pursuing a bachelor’s degree. He is in his fourth year at a university in the city. He is from the Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. He is also working in a fast food restaurant. He has worked since 2014, earning $4 a day.

Samnang is requesting a loan because he lacks the finances to pay the fourth year tuition fees. This loan will help him earn a bachelor’s degree successfully with skills to build a better future.

After graduation, he is going to find another better job with a reasonable salary, so he will be able to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to pay his fourth-year tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy tools for her husband's furniture making business.

loans.name: Phanice's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Phanice, often described as an extremely experienced farmer. She is 35 years old. As a group leader, she is representing her group of 13 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She is married and has two children.

Phanice is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again. This means that she is able to have access to the best seed prices, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Phanice says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2014, she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. Her day-to-day life has improved significantly. Phanice will use the profits from this season to send her children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 7.25 acres. Some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan. The group will receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom, 57, is the mother of four children and lives with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession. He has been selling fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. He offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the income generated from this vegetable shop. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family have suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize his vegetable sales. Therefore, Kalsoom requested a loan so her husband would be able to buy more vegetables to sell.

Kalsoom is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more vegetable for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Opanda's Group

texts.en:
Opanda's Group is formed by 14 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Opanda, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 57 years old, is married, and has 4 children. Opanda has been a farmer for 10 years and he is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Opanda isn’t new to One Acre Fund; he actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year, Opanda will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Opanda's Group will purchase a total of 7 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 8 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet a new Ruma agent, Siti. Siti lives in Bogor, a semi-urban area located about an hour drive from Jakarta. She lives there with her family. Siti is still a university student. She decided to join Ruma because she wants to improve her life, learn how to become an entrepreneur, and increase her savings, as well as contribute more to her community. 

With support and encourage from Ruma’s staff, Siti has already become a mobile payment service provider. As the business grows, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to process more mobile payment services for her community. Your loan will be very useful to help Siti improve her business and accordingly, her community which needs access to such services. 

Siti is pictured sitting in the photo above. She will be thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services to her community

loans.name: Cisney Amparo

texts.es:
Portoviejo es la capital de la provincia de Manabí en Ecuador. Conocida por ser la primera ciudad ecuatoriana más antigua asentada en la región costanera,  está  ganando terreno en el turismo ya que este cantón posee playa, ciudad y campo.
En este lugar vive la señora Cisney,  tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene un  hijo de 4 años que estudia en inicial. Su esposo es conserje de un jardín particular. Viven con familiares.
Doña Cisney con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos de Avon, Esika, Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas) además de ropa y zapatos por catálogo, trabaja todos los fines de la semana ya que de lunes a viernes trabaja como cajera en una empresa de venta de ropa, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, esto lo viene realizando desde hace tres años en los que le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene bastante clientela. Lo que más vende son los cosméticos y los perfumes. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y ropa. Le gusta de la fundación los beneficios que le brindan los créditos escolares, emergentes, seguro salud. Su sueño es incrementar el negocio, comprar una casa ya que donde vive es de familiares y comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Portoviejo is the capital of Manabí province in Ecuador. It is renowned as the first city to be settled and therefore the oldest city on the Ecuadorian coast. This region is gaining ground in tourism for its combination of beach, city and countryside. 

Cisney lives in this region. Cisney is 32 years old, married and with her husband has a 4 year old in kindergarten. Her husband is a caretaker of a private garden. They live with relatives. 

With the purpose of having her own income, Cisney makes a living selling catalogue products for Avon, Esika and Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies accessories), as well as clothes and shoes via catalogue. Cisney works doing this every weekend, during the week she works as a cashier in a clothing store. 

Cisney works door-to-door, she gives credit and collects money weekly, and she has been doing this job for three years. The business is going well and she has plenty of customers. 

The best-selling products are cosmetics and perfumes. Cisney will use this loan to buy perfumes, costume jewellry, cosmetics, creams and articles of clothing. 

What Cisney likes about the foundation is the education loans and health insurance. Her dream is to grow her business, buy a house where she can live with her family and buy a car.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, costume jewellry, cosmetics, creams and articles of clothing.

loans.name: Trust Group

texts.en:
Martha is the mother of two grown children. She is a widow and supports her life by running a general store which sells a variety of products such as maize and baking flour, sweets, cooking oil, sugar, soaps, etc. She has been in this business for seven years, working from 7:30am to 10pm every working day. She is able to make a fair profit. 

Martha is now requesting her sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans, all repaid back successfully, to stock more items in her shop. She managed to make a small profit which she used to cover her welfare costs. With this new request, she will buy products to resell in her general store (rice, maize and baking flour, cooking oils and other most demanded products from her customers). 

She will share this loan with her group, Trust, totalling five members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Martha dreams of buying a car.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store.

loans.name: Sylvester's Group

texts.en:
Sylvester, featured in the above picture, is representing his farming group formed by 16 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. He is 60 years old and is a married father of 10 children, often described as a very resourceful person. 

Although Sylvester has been a farmer for 5 years, he is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because he really wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Even though he is new to the program, Sylvester wanted to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Sylvester hopes to be able to send his children to school.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 10.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 9 solar lights, as, even though Sylvester decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is a 67-year-old married male who grows maize as his major crop. He lives in Masindi, Uganda with his eight children. He does carpentry as his side business to generate additional income. 

The need to sustain his family led him to start up a business. His dream is educating his children to university, although price fluctuations have remained a challenge. Lawrence is a hardworking man who wants a loan to buy pesticides and support weeding his crop.

The photo was taken when Lawrence was carrying his child, who would not let go of him.

loans.use: to weed and buy pesticides.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Flordeliza works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Flordeliza is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Flordeliza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Nerma

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Nerma works hard to support her family.

She has a native mat-making business in the Philippines, and also earns an income from a general store. Nerma is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her native mat-making business.

Nerma has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her native mat-making business.

loans.name: Chrisandos's Group

texts.en:
Chrisandos is a 53-year-old proud father of six children. Often described as a very hardworking individual, Chrisandos is a group leader and is representing his group of 12 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Chrisandos has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Chrisandos described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to repair his home.

With this loan, Chrisandos’s Group will be able to plant a total of five acres of land and purchase a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Pratiwi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Pratiwi. Pratiwi lives in Cilegon, located about two hours' drive from Jakarta. Pratiwi lives there with her husband and her only child. 

She owns a stall where she provides mobile payment services for her community. She joined Ruma in 2013 and this is the second time she is applying for a loan from Kiva. The previous loan helped her to process more mobile airtime credits for her community and she thanks all of the lenders because of it.

With support and encourage from Ruma’s staff, now Pratiwi sees a lot of improvements in her business. As the business grows, she is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to process more mobile payment services for her community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Pratiwi improve her business and, accordingly, her community who needs access to such services. 

As seen in the photo, Pratiwi is the one who is holding her child. She will be thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment transactions for her community

loans.name: Sreynang

texts.en:
Sreynang is a 25-year-old single student, who is pursuing a Bachelor’s degree, majoring in accounting at a university in the city. She is from Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. Her father is a civil servant and her mother is a farmer. 

Due to the fact that Sreynang is short of the money to cover her university fees from the second to the fourth year, she would like to secure a loan. With this loan, she will graduate successfully. For her future plans after graduation, she is going to find a job and save money to run her own business. She also wants to renovate the house.

loans.use: to cover her university fees.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 28 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de comida rápida.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, constante, paciente, amable, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona Central un área caracterizada por el comercio en todas las áreas, y que alberga a universidades, oficinas públicas y empresas privadas que conviven lado a lado, de clima frío y seco, con una temperatura ambiente entre 14-24 grados centígrados que varía durante el día.
María es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Quechua que habla en familia y habla español por cultural general y para el negocio que realiza. su vida la realiza en compañía de su madre que trabaja en el mercado de verduras, viven en una casa propia en las afueras de la ciudad construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua de pozo y electricidad. Su negocio es la venta de comida rápida, como; hamburguesas con papas fritas, salchipapas (salchicha frita con papas fritas), pollo frito y otros. Actividad que realiza durante el día en un carrito con ruedas en la calle, tapada con 2 sombrillas y unos banquitos para que sus clientes se sienten. “anteriormente trabajaba como ayudante de mi mamá en el mercado de verduras, luego me independicé y con su ayuda logré comprar este carrito que es mi principal herramienta de trabajo…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un cuarto dónde poder preparar y vender comida bajo techo, ella desea realizar la compra de bancos para sentarse, una garrafa de gas e insumos de cocina, como; pollo, salchichas, aceite y otros, para vender a mayor cantidad de clientes y aumentar sus ventas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 8 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de banquitos e insumos de cocina para atender a mayor número de clientes y mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Maria is 28 years old, single, and has no children. Her business is selling fast food. She is enterprising, independent, consistent, patient, friendly, responsible and hard-working. Her business takes place in the Central area which has commerce from all over and houses universities, public offices and private companies who live side by side in a cold and dry climate. The temperature varies between 14 to 24 degrees Celsius during the day.

María is dark-skinned with long black hair she ties up, has dark eyes, is low in stature and of medium build. Her native language is Quechua which she speaks with her family and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for her business. She lives her life in company with her mother who works in the vegetable market. They live in their own house on the outskirts of the city. It is built of bricks and cement with a metal roof and has well-water and electricity. Her business is selling fast food like hamburgers with french fries, salchipapas (sausage and fried potatoes), fried chicken and others

She does her business during the day from a cart on wheels in the street with two umbrellas for cover and some benches for her clients to sit on. “ Before I used to work as an assistant to my mother in the vegetable market. Later I went put on my own and with her help bought this cart which is my main work tool,” she commented.

Her dream is to have a room where she can prepare and sell her food under a roof. She wants to make the purchase of benches to sit on, a gas container and cooking supplies like chicken, sausages, oil and others to sell to a greater number of clients and increase her sales.

This is her first loan with the institution in the 8 years she has been in business. For these reasons Maria is requesting a loan to buy benches and coooking supplies to serve a greater number of people and improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy benches and cooking supplies to serve a greater number of clients and improve her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production, to increase milk supply and  meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 40 years old and married with three children.

Jenalyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, sugar, eggs, etc.

Jenalyn has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for fifteen years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Jenalyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Luzbella

texts.en:
Luzbella is 49 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raining pigs in the Philippines. Luzbella is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Luzbella has been in this business for 3 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 56 years old and a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Gloria has a business selling seafood in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 13 years. Gloria requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Arceli has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from general store.

Arceli requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Reyna

texts.en:
Reyna is 33 years old and a married woman with four children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

Reyna has requested a PHP 27,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment. She has been in this business for three years. In the future, Reyna would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Joann

texts.en:
Joann is 39 years old and married with four children.

Joann works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, canned good, noodles, sugar, eggs, coffee, and milk.

Joann has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from raising pigs and selling rice.

Joann aspires to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, canned good, noodles, sugar, eggs, coffee, and milk

loans.name: Dahlia

texts.en:
Dahlia is 48 years old and married with four children. Dahlia works very hard to provide for them.

Dahlia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Dahlia has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Dahlia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.
