loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian, 46, is a smallholder dairy farmer from the Litein region of Kenya. Lilian has ambitions of growing her business and providing her family with a high standard of living. Her major challenge, however, is lack of capital. The money she is making currently is meagre and is usually used up on family basic needs.

Lilian is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to buy a dairy cow. With an additional cow, she can count on having an additional 15 litres or so daily. This investment will enable her to reach out to more customers and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 38 years old. She is married with three children who are between 5 and 14 years old. They all go to school.  

She is a farmer and has been producing rice for 20 years. Also, her husband is a businessman. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizer to grow rice and to sell it. The profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees of her children and to buy cattle for rearing.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer to grow rice and to sell it.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is aged 61 years. She is married with five children aged between 15 and 39 years. Three of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been producing rice for 34 years. Also her husband is a farmer.

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers to grow rice and to sell the rice. The profits from the business will be used to buy medical insurance and to pay school fees of her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers to grow rice and to sell the rice.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna is a 61 year old widowed woman with three children. One of her children is still in school.

Elna has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Elna requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, oil, sugar, etc for her food production business.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, oil, sugar, etc for her food production business.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 59 years old. She is married with six children aged between 14 and 31 years. Two of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been producing rice for 29 years. Also, her husband is a businessman.  With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizer to grow and to sell the rice. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer to grow rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Herminda De Jesus

texts.es:
Herminda, de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casada y es madre de 3 hijos, dos de ellos están estudiando.

Herminda, se dedica a atender una pequeña tienda que tiene desde hace un año, el esposo trabaja en el cuartel,  aunque ya no están juntos, él le ayuda económicamente para sus hijos.

Herminda, invertira el crédito para comprar productos para surtir más su tienda y que esto le permita obtener mejores ingresos.

El sueño de Herminda, es poder construir su propia casita y darles a sus hijos mejor calidad de vida  y que puedan terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Herminda, 37, stayed in education until high school. She is married with 3 children, 2 of whom are studying. 

Herminda runs a small shop which she has had for a year. Her husband works in the army. Although they are no longer together, he gives her economic support for the children. 

Herminda will invest the loan in buying products to better stock her shop, which will allow her to make more income. 

Herminda dreams of being able to build her own house, of giving her children a better quality of life, and of her children being able to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy products with which to better stock her shop

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a 36 year old client and new to the institution. He does agriculture as his major source of income. He has been doing this business for over 15 years. He is also a medical worker and he earns a salary. However he relies mostly on his agriculture business.

He applied for a loan of UGX 3,500,000 to buy agricultural inputs like fertilizers, mulching materials and manure to use in his banana plantation so as to increase his production. Alex hopes to expand his plantation to a modern level and becomes a model farmer in the area.

Alex thanks Ugafode for the financial assistance which he hopes will increase his income and gradually improve his standard of living. He appreciates the Kiva cause and support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers mulch and manure for his banana plantation.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is 40 years old. He is married with five children aged between 2 and 19 years, 3 of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been producing rice for 21 years. Also his wife is a farmer.

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers to grow rice and sell it. The profits from the business will be used to buy seeds for rice production.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers.

loans.name: Teresa's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Teresa, often described as an extremely hard-working individual. She is 44 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of nine farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She is married and has four children.

Teresa is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again since this means that she is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Teresa says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2014, she has learned a lot from farming trainings, which has significantly improved her day-to-day life. Teresa will use the profits from this season to send her children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 5.5 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of three solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy materials and sewing equipment to meet his customers' demands.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable her to get income, which she will use to open up a retail shop after selling milk.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is 49 years old and married, with one child. 

She is managing a store selling grocery items and vegetables in her store. Irma aspires to business improvement, and that is why she is diversifying her business to attain more profits. 

She is now asking for additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, eggs, bread, noodles, soap, and shampoo to sell. This way, she will increase sales capacity and improve her income. She promises to pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, bread, noodles, soap, and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Johana Del Rocio

texts.es:
Portoviejo es la capital de la provincia de Manabí en Ecuador. Conocida por ser la primera ciudad ecuatoriana más antigua asentada en la región costanera,  está  ganando terreno en el turismo ya que este cantón posee playa, ciudad y campo.
En este lugar vive la señora Johana, tiene 36 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 16, 12 y 9 años los mismos que estudian 2 en el colegio  y uno en escuela. El cónyuge trabaja en el municipio.
Doña Johana se dedica a la cría de cerdos en una pequeña granja en sus casa, ella como es ama de casa tiene tiempo para atenderlos y su cónyuge le ayuda los fines de semana. Los cerdos los faenan y luego venden la carne por libras,  lleva 15 años dedicada a esta labor y les ha ido bastante bien ya que es una forma de ganar algo desde su casa.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar cerdos, comida y vacunas. Tiene tres años en el Grupo De Crédito y está muy contenta porque el grupo es muy unido y los beneficios de la fundación son muy buenos. Su sueño es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Portoviejo is the capital of the province of Manabí in Ecuador. Known as the oldest settled city in the coastal region it is gaining ground in tourism as the canton has beach, city and countryside.

Johana lives in this place. She is 36 years old and is in a common-law relationship from which she has 3 children aged 16, 12 and 9 years old. Two of them study in High school and the other is in Primary school. He partner works for the municipality.

Johana works raising pigs at a small farm at her house. as a housewife she has time to take care of them and her husband helps her on week-ends. They butcher the pigs and sell the meat by the pound. She has 15 years working in this business and things have gone quite well for her as it is a way to earn some money from her house. This new loan will be used to buy pigs, feed and vaccines. She has been in the communal bank for 3 years and is very content as the group is very united and the benefits from the foundation are very good. Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy pigs, food and vaccines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow, which will increase her milk supply to meet an increasing demand and increase her income.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda is 39 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for one year.

Criselda requested a loan from NWTF for 11,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more stocks such as canned goods, noodles, sugar, milk, coffee, breads, etc. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, sugar, milk, coffee, breads, etc.

loans.name: Eddah

texts.en:
Eddah is 24 years old. She is from Kapsogut village in South Rift area of Kenya. Eddah owns a small farm where she practices dairy farming. 

Eddah wants to start a poultry farm. She is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy a few heads of poultry that will get the business started. Chicken products and byproducts will benefit Eddah's family as well as her business. Income from dairy farming will be used to make initial installment payments but as the poultry business gains traction, it will grow to become sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Nicholus's Group

texts.en:
Nicholus has nine children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why he was selected to become the group leader of his group. Nicholus is representing his group of nine farmers in Kakamega North District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Nicholus has been a farmer for more than 30 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting as that means he will now have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, Nicholus is planning to send his children to school.

A total of four acres will be planted by Nicholus's Group, and between them they will receive a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Florida Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLORIDA” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juliana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de CD’s, venta de salchipapas, venta de ropa, salón de belleza, venta de frazadas, venta de verduras, venta de frutas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juliana es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de frutas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años al emprender un pequeño negocio de tienda de barrio, con el pasar del tiempo decide implementar en ese espacio frutas, producto con el cual le fue mejor y decidió continuarlo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de frutas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The B.C. "Florida" will initiate it's sixth cycle of Pro Mujer, as a part of the Focal Center Collpani, is composed of nine members and is directed by a board with Mrs. Juliana as the president. Previously the members of the organization worked in a variety of businesses, such as a neighborhood store, selling CD's, selling salchipapas, selling clothing, beauty salon, selling blankets, selling vegetables, and selling fruits.

The loan that they took will benefit small mircoentrepreneurs where Mrs. Juliana is integral. For six years Pro Mujer has been entering by the invitation of her friend who is a client of the institution. Today she has a business selling fruit. She discloses that she learned this business several years ago to start a neighborhood shop. With the passage of time she decided to include selling fruits in the space, a product that was faring better so she decided to continue selling it.

The loan that they now will take is for the increase of capital (buying wholesale fruits) that will acquire better sellers in the city of La Paz and later will commercialize her selling space. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, since she is single and has a child.

When she is asked if she likes Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training that the institution offers her.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fruits.

loans.name: Mijgona

texts.en:
Mijgona is 25 years old. She is divorced from her husband. Now, she lives with her parents in Gissar region. 

Mijgona works in a dress-making business. She has engaged in this activity for three years. Thanks to her work, Mijgona can provide for her family. 

Now, she plans to buy a new, modern sewing machine, so that she will be able to sew better and get more clients. Her main difficulty is the lack of money. 

Mijgona hopes that, with the help of Kiva lenders, she can fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to buy a new, modern sewing machine.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 39 years old and married with one child. One child is still in school, Vilma works very hard to provide for them.

Vilma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, sugar, eggs, coffee, milk, etc.

Vilma has been in this business for 15 years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, sugar, eggs, coffee, milk, etc.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Bernard, who is very ambitious and always jovial. For a living, Bernard cultivates crops and keeps dairy animals. His main source of income are milk and produce sales.
Bernard is actively seeking to expand his farm. With this loan, Bernard will pay for labor and inputs to cultivate more land and plant more maize and other crops. 
At the end of the season, the additional income Bernard makes from this investment would help to keep expanding his business and improving his family's livelihood.

loans.use: to pay for the expansion of his farm

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee is a 64-year-old married mother of seven children, ages 15 to 33 years, with three in school. She is a farmer and has been producing rice for 27 years. Her husband is a businessman. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizer. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee is 49 years old. She is married and has six children between the ages of 7 and 25. They all go to school. She is a farmer, and she has been producing rice for 24 years. Her husband is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers. The profits from the business will be used to buy medical insurance and to pay school fees of her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers

loans.name: Boniface's Group

texts.en:
Boniface, featured in the above picture, is representing his farming group formed by 8 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. He is 39 years old and a married father of 5 children, often described as a very hardworking individual. 

Although Boniface has been a farmer for 18 years, he is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because he really wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Even though he is new to the program, Boniface wanted to represent his group because he wanted to be more active in his community. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Boniface hopes to be able to send his children to school.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 4 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 4 solar lights, as, even though Boniface decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Emile

texts.en:
Emile is 23 years old. He is not married. He is a farmer and he has been producing rice for 7 years. 

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizer to grow rice and to sell it. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer to grow rice and to sell it.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Moses, an aspiring 20-year-old farmer from Motosiet village. At a tender age, Moses has embraced the spirit of entrepreneurship and is in farming to feed the rapidly growing population of Kenya. 

Moses' main income source is milk. This year, he is exploring other opportunities in the agricultural sector. Moses is seeking a KES 30,000 loan from Kiva lenders to venture into poultry farming. 

Poultry farming has so many products and byproducts to offer. Poultry industry growth is also driven by the expanding hotel and tourism industry. Moses believes there is so much to expect from this business move. Profits from this investment will be rolled back into the business to fuel growth.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Аbdusamad

texts.ru: Абдусамад добродушный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 48 лет. Он женат. Со своей семьёй Абдусамад живут в сельском посёлке. Для того, чтобы иметь доход на проживание Абдусамад занимается своим бизнесом. Вот уже на протяжении 10 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхозкультуру, а также выращивает картошку. Затем, когда собирает урожай, вывозит на большой базар и там продаёт свой урожай. Раньше он занимался деканством и потом решил реализовывать свой урожай. Также как дополнительный доход, Абдусамад имеет от другого вида бизнеса. У него имеется несколько голов скота, которых он выращивает для дальнейшей продажи. Но сейчас Абдусамад хочет расширить бизнес, именно по выращиванию сельхозкультуры. Но сейчас у него недостаточно собственных денежных средств, чтобы закупить семена для посева урожая. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет взять кредит для закупа семян для посева. Абдусамад очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Аbdusamad is a kind and hardworking 48-year-old man. He is married. Аbdusamad and his family live in a rural village. Аbdusamad has his own business in order to earn a living. He has been involved in growing agricultural crops and potatoes for 10 years. He gathers his harvest and takes it to a large market, where he sells it. Previously, he was involved in dekhan farming and then decided to sell his own harvest. To provide additional income, Аbdusamad has another business. He has several heads of livestock that he fattens up for subsequent sale. Now Аbdusamad wants to expand his agricultural business, but does not have enough money to buy seeds for planting the crop. This is why he came to Arvand and wants to obtain a loan to buy seeds for sowing. Аbdusamad really hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for sowing his next crop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow, so as to increase her milk production for selling and thereby increase her overall income.

loans.name: Artemio

texts.en: Artemio is 57 years old, married and has four children. His dream is to develop his bakery business in his town. His wife is helping him manage their bakery business. They sell a variety of breads in their stall. Artemio wants to assure that at their age, they maintain good health so that they would be able to manage their business well. He wants to borrow PHP 50,000 to buy flour, sugar, and coconut for making bread. In the end, Artemio will develop the business by using his loan wisely.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and coconut for making bread.

loans.name: Katherine Maribel

texts.es:
Portoviejo es la capital de la provincia de Manabí en Ecuador. Conocida por ser la primera ciudad ecuatoriana más antigua asentada en la región costanera,  está  ganando terreno en el turismo ya que este cantón posee playa, ciudad y campo.
En este lugar vive la señorita Katherine, tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera  y vive en casa de sus padres que es propia.
Doña Katherine con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de ropa  por catálogos (camisetas, camisas, shorts y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días más que todo en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos,  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente,  esto lo viene realizando desde hace ocho meses en los que le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene bastante clientela. Lo que más vende son camisetas tanto para damas y caballeros. Ella está realizando su tesis para incorporarse de Lcda. Ciencia de la Educación
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace tres años y le gusta la unidad del grupo y la buena atención que recibe de parte de la fundación. Sus sueños es ejercer su profesión y ayudarle a la mamá a mejorar la casa y hacer una maestría.
texts.en:
Portoviejo is the capital of the Ecuador's Manabí province. It is known for being the oldest city on the Ecuadorian coast, and is becoming more and more popular with tourists, as the canton includes beach, city and countryside.

This is where Katherine lives, she is 24, single and lives with her parents in the house they own.

With the aim of earning her own income, Katherine sells clothing via catalog (shirts, t-shirts, shorts and ladies accessories). She works every day, particularly in the mornings as this is the time she finds it easiest to perform her rounds. She works door to door, sells on credit and collects every week. She has been doing this for eight months, it has been going well and she now has quite a few customers. Her most popular products are t-shirts, for both men and women. She is currently working on her thesis for a degree in Education.

She will use this loan to buy more goods, such as trousers, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing. She has been part of this Credit Group for three years, and she likes the unity of the group and the good care she receives as part of the foundation. 

Her dreams are to pursue her career, help her mother to improve the home and to study for a masters.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Harold

texts.en:
While he is working as family driver, Harold still has the chance to manage the selling of vehicle spare parts and a sari-sari store. With the help of his wife caring for their children, they are able to manage the businesses. They help each other to meet their children's necessities and to give them a better way of living. 

Harold wishes for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy grocery items to sell. He will also use the loan to buy piston rings, break shoes, and vehicle wheels to sell. Harold believes that by borrowing the loan, he will able to improve his business and get a higher income.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 33 years old. She is married and has one child, aged one year. She is a farmer, and she has been producing rice for 15 years. Her husband is a farmer, also. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers and to pay workers. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and to pay workers.

loans.name: Ageliques

texts.en:
Angeliques is 33 years old. She is married and has three children, aged one to six years. She is a farmer, and she has been producing rice for 15 years. Her husband is a business man. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers and pay workers. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and pay workers.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet Joyce. Joyce is a lovely, jovial and hardworking 28-year-old farmer. Joyce's main income comes from selling bananas that she grows on her small farmland. She has always had plans to diversify into other farming activities when the stars align.

Joyce is seeking a loan investment from Kiva lenders to venture into dairy farming. She is going to use your loan to purchase a dairy cow.

Some of the milk produced from the cow will be for family consumption, but most of it will be sold, and the money will go towards loan repayment. Once the loan is fully serviced, Joyce will use the money to grow her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Kelezenzia's Group

texts.en:
Kelezenzia, pictured above, has been a farmer for 10 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 13 farmers in Kakamega North District. She is 44 years old, married and has seven children.

Kelezenzia likes to think of herself as a very experienced farmer. She has been working with One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has had more profits from each harvest. Kelezenzia plans to use the profits from this coming season to save more money for the future.

In total, Kelezenzia’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 7.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Geofrey's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Geofrey, who is often described as an extremely hardworking individual. He is 50 years old, and he is representing his group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. He is married and has three children.

Geofrey is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again. This means that he is able to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, which is why he decided to join One Acre Fund in the first place. Geofrey says that he is happy to have made that decision, because since he first joined in 2014, he has learned a lot from farming trainings, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. Geofrey will use the profits from this season to send his children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 7.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Maftuna

texts.en:
Maftuna is a hard-working woman. She was born in 1990. She is from the northern part of the country. She lives in a remote district. She is single and lives with her parents. 

Maftuna was a participant in 'Women Entrepreneurs Achieve Success' training. After the training, she started her business of serving women, sewing traditional dresses. 

However, her basic income is from selling agricultural and dairy products. She has livestock and land where she plants agricultural products. 

She is planning to improve her living conditions. She is asking for financial support to renovate her apartment and she hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to renovate her apartment.

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.en: Shahlo is an honest woman. She was born in 1987. She has been living since 1987. She is married. She has three children. Shahlo is a businesswoman. She is a seamstress. She sews traditional dresses for women and sells her dresses in the domestic market. Now she needs to buy a new sewing machine for the benefit of her business. Shahlo needs financial support from Kiva project to buy a new sewing machine. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Calixto

texts.en: Calixto is great at making different designs of furniture. He uses his skills to improve his family's standards of living. Calixto is married to a housewife, and they have been blessed with three children. He aims to expand the business to earn more income for the education of his children. Calixto wants to borrow a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy wood and varnish for his furniture-making business. He will manage the business well to grow it so that he can further sustain his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy wood and varnish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and additional items to sell.

loans.name: Elden

texts.en:
Elden is a 46 years old and married. She operates a sari-sari store in Carles, Iloilo, which she has been doing for more than 25 years now. 

Elden is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more stocks of canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, bread, and biscuits. A loan will help her improve her inventories thus attracting more buyers to her store.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, bread, and biscuits

loans.name: Gerard

texts.en: Gerard is a 34-year-old fisherman from Carles, Iloilo. He is married and has three children. Gerard has been in the business for more than 11 years now. He is asking to take a loan to buy a fishing boat and a motor engine. A loan will help him improve his business as well as his income. In the future, Gerard hopes to make his business a success. He also wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat and a motor engine

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is a 57-year-old married man and a father of 10 grown up children. Alexander lives with his family in Carles, Iloilo. He is a fisherman. 

Alexander has been in the fishing business for several years now. This is the source of his income. 

Alexander is asking to take a loan to buy new fishing nets and a new boat engine. A loan will help him to improve his fishing business as well as his income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and a new boat engine

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is engaged in a vending business while her husband works as a driver. They have one child who goes to school. Lolita is a patient mother, who is not getting tired of selling her products just to have an income. She is selling blankets, mosquito nets, and many more. Through her source of income, she can provide their daily food. 

Lolita is preparing for her child’s education. That’s why she needs to increase her income the same as her husband. Lolita is requesting a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy blankets, pillowcases, and other kitchen utensils to sell. She performs the business daily to assure that she has regular earnings.

loans.use: to buy blankets, pillowcases, and kitchen utensils to sell.

loans.name: Gibs

texts.en:
Gibs is 25 years old, married, and has one child. He is a fisherman from Carles, Iloilo, which he has been doing for several years. 

Gibs is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and floaters. This loan will help Gibs in improving his fishing business thus augmenting his income and profit.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and floaters

loans.name: Francis's Group

texts.en:
Francis, pictured above, has 10 children. He is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why he was selected to become the group leader of his group. Francis is representing his group of nine farmers in Kakamega North District. He is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time, this year.

Francis has been a farmer for more than 40 years. He decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. With the profits from this coming season, Francis is planning to send his children to school.

A total of 4.5 acres will be planted by Francis's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, and a solar-powered light.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Paul. Paul and his family live in Chepterit village which is in the North Rift area of Kenya. His main income source is milk. However, Paul's plan for 2015 is to expand his income sources. 
Paul is seeking a KES 45,000 loan from Kiva lenders to grow his business by buying poultry, rabbits and animal feed.. 
With this investment, Paul will be able to increase his family income by selling products and byproducts from cows, hens and rabbits.

loans.use: to buy poultry, rabbits and feed.

loans.name: Josiane

texts.en:
Josiane, age 37 years, is married with four children ages 2 to 9 years, and two of them go to school. She is a farmer, and she has been producing rice for 20 years. Also, her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizer to grow rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy medical insurance and to pay school fees for her children.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer to grow rice to sell.

loans.name: Hellen's Group

texts.en: Hellen is often described as an extremely hardworking person. She is 36 years old and, as a group leader, is representing her group of 13 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.  She is married and has thee children. Helen is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that she is able to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Hellen says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she joined last year, she has learned a lot from farming trainings, which have improved her day-to-day life significantly. Hellen will use the profits she earns this season to buy more land to cultivate. Her group will use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 7.25 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar lights with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize

loans.name: Hurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 38 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Со своей семьёй  Хуршед живут в сельском посёлке. Для того, чтобы иметь доход на проживание Хуршед занимается своим бизнесом. Вот уже на протяжении нескольких лет он занимается выращиванием сельхозкультуру, а также выращивает картошку. Также как дополнительный доход,  Хуршед имеет от другого вида бизнеса. У него имеется несколько голов скота, которых он выращивает для дальнейшей продажи. Но сейчас  Хуршед хочет расширить бизнес, именно по выращиванию сельхозкультуры. Но сейчас у него недостаточно собственных денежных средств, чтобы закупить семена для посева урожая. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет взять кредит для посева картошки.  Хуршед очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Hurshed is a kind and hardworking 38-year-old man. He is married and has three children. Hurshed and his family live in a rural village. Hurshed has his own business in order to earn a living. He has been involved in growing agricultural crops and potatoes for many years. To earn additional income, Hurshed has another business. He has several heads of livestock that he fattens up for subsequent sale. Now Hurshed wants to expand his agricultural business, but does not have enough money to buy seeds for planting the crop. This is why he came to Arvand and wants to obtain a loan to buy seeds for planting potatoes. Hurshed really hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods to sell to the customers.

loans.name: Phun's Group

texts.en: Phun’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Phun makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 38 years old, married, and has seven children. She is from Carles, Iloilo. She operates a fishing business with her husband, which she has been doing for more than 10 years.  

Grace is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy a new fishing boat. This loan will improve their fishing business as well as their income. Grace dreams of expanding their fishing venture in order to generate more revenue for their sustenance and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase a new fishing boat

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en:
Zuhro was born in 1988, is single, and lives in the northern part of the country. She is an experienced agrarian woman. She is busy with planting agricultural products and keeping livestock. She has a dream to open her own farm for keeping livestock.

Zuhro is asking financial support from Kiva lenders to buy livestock. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 36-year-old married mother of four children. Since 1985, she has been working in Mouneh, preservation of fruits and vegetables, and has a great deal of experience in her business domain due to her mother's training.  Mariam runs her business from her house and works hard to support her family.

Mariam is requesting a loan to increase her business merchandise and purchase special seasonal fruits and vegetables to preserve for the coming seasons and grow her Mouneh business. She will use her loan to develop her business properly and she hopes to open her own display shop in the future. Mariam hopes to provide her children with the best education to make sure they will benefit from a brighter future.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise and purchase special seasonal fruits and vegetables to preserve for the coming seasons and grow her Mouneh business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new boat engine

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 31 years old. She is married with 2 children who are 2 and 4 years old. They do not go to school. 

She is a farmer and has been producing rice for 12 years. Also her husband is a business man. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizer to grow rice and to sell it. The profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees of her children and to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer to grow rice and to sell it.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is a married woman and the mother of three children. She is from Carles, Iloilo. She has been running a fishing business with her husband for more than four years now. This is the source of their income.

Lanie is asking to take a loan to buy a new fishing boat and a new boat engine. A loan will help her and her husband to improve their fishing business as well as their income. Lanie dreams of making their business more sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat and a new boat engine

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en:
Gulnara is a 54-year-old woman from the village of Keshalo. She has only a 26-year-old son, who is temporarily unemployed. The only breadwinner in the family is Gulnara, who is a teacher and gets 300 GEL monthly. She has a great desire to start a business that will be a significant source of income for her poor family.

To realize her business plan, Gulnara requested a loan from local credit providers. She couldn’t receive a loan from the local financial institutions because of their requirements to have business experience or enough family income, until the Start Up program, a joint product of Kiva and Credo, began. The program allows poor people Like Gulnara to get a chance for starting or re-starting businesses. With the requested amount, she will renovate the space, will purchase all needed tools and open a car wash service. Her son will greatly help her to make the business activity productive for their family.

Gulnara thinks that the business will be lucrative, as it's in a good location and the only business of this kind in the area. She will be very grateful for the help, as the activity will give her a chance to make a significant source of income and live better.

loans.use: to open a car wash service and make a significant source of income.

loans.name: Tenaida De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Portoviejo es la capital de la provincia de Manabí en Ecuador. Conocida por ser la primera ciudad ecuatoriana más antigua asentada en la región costanera,  está  ganando terreno en el turismo ya que este cantón posee playa, ciudad y campo.
En este lugar vive la señora Tenaida, tiene 52 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis hijos mayores de edad e independientes. El cónyuge es albañil, viven en casa propia.
Doña Tenaida para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar hace veinte años empezó un negocio, ella tiene un pequeño comedor en su casa en el cual prepara deliciosos platos, trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 8h00 hasta las 21h00. Trabaja  con una nuera que le ayuda.  Siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que sus clientes la prefieren por la sazón que le pone a sus platos lo que la hace especial.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar sillas, mesas, ollas y víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace tres años  y  le gusta que los créditos porque son rápidos. Su meta es mejorar el negocio y la casa donde vive.
texts.en:
Portoviejo is the capital of Manabí province in Ecuador. It is known as the oldest Ecuadorean town in the coastal region. Tourism is starting to gain ground in the canton as it has a beach, and both urban and rural attractions.

52-year old Sra. Tenaida lives there with her partner. They have six adult children who no longer live at home. Her husband works in construction; they live in their own home.

To help her husband with household expenses, Tenaida started a business 20 years ago. She runs a small restaurant in her house where she serves delicious meals. She works Monday to Saturday from 8 am to 9 pm with help from her daughter-in-law. Her business has always done very well as her customers choose her restaurant over others because of the way she seasons the food she makes.

Tenaida plans to use the loan to buy chairs, tables, pans and food ingredients. She has been in her loan group for three years and likes it because loans are made rapidly. Her goal is to improve her business and the house where she lives.

loans.use: buy chairs, tables, pans, and ingredients

loans.name: José Armando

texts.es:
José, de 64 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, está casado y es padre de 4 hijos, los cuales ya son independientes y en su casa solo vive con su esposa y un nieto.

José, se dedica a la agricultura y la ganaderia desde hace 6 años, cultiva granos básicos en una pequeña parcela cerca de su casa.

José, invertirá el crédito para comprar ganado, para mejorar su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias.

El sueño de José, es mejorar su negocio y poder dar a su familia mejores condiciones de
texts.en:
64-year old José has a grade one education. He is married and has four children, all of whom live independently. Only he, his wife, and a grandson live in the house.

José is a farmer and has also raised cattle for six years. He grows basic grains on a small plot of land near his house. He plans to use the loan money to buy cattle and in this way improve his business and increase his income.

José’s greatest wish is to see his business grow so he can provide his family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: buy cattle

loans.name: Everlyne's Group

texts.en:
Everlyne is 37 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. She has 4 children and is married. As a group leader, Everlyne is representing her group of 6 farmers in Kakamega North District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Everlyne's desire to earn enough to feed her family. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

Everlyne and her group will receive a total of 5 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 2.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Kagongi Women's Group

texts.en: The Kagongi Women’s Group is located in the Kagongi Trading Centre and comprised mainly of women who are either married, divorced or widowed mothers. Imelda is a married mother who lives with her husband and three small children in the village of Ekiikira in Kagongi. She earns a living by running a small bar and shop which she opened with capital of Ugx. 200,000. She uses the income she earns here to care for her family. She has applied for a loan to buy more items to sell, including rice, corn flour, sugar, and soap. Her goal is to increase her working capital and use the rest of the money to pay  school fees for her children. Her customers are neighbors and a few visitors. Imelda is a very hardworking woman despite the fact that she faces challenges, including insufficient capital to expand her business and the occasional illness of her children, which affects her cash flow.  She and the other group members thank Kiva lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Benard's Group

texts.en:
Benard, featured in the above picture, is representing his farming group formed by six farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. He is 35 years old and a married father of five children. He is often described as a very resourceful person. 

Although Benard has been a farmer for 10 years, he is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year, because he really wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Even though he is new to the program, Benard wanted to represent his group, because he wanted to gain leadership skills. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Benard hopes to be able to invest in a business.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 2.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of four solar lights.  Even though Benard decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.en:
Gulnar is a 30-year-old houskeeper. She is married; her husband is a gardener and they have two sons. The family's income comes from gardening. Gulnar is also a gardener and together they raise such fruits as apples, pomegranates, and pears, and sell the harvest to local markets and groceries. Gulnar also makes juice and jam from these fruits, and sells them. Fruit juice is very good for health and jam is very tasty with tea. Her monthly income from selling juice and jam is 155AZN. 

Gulnar loves her garden very much, and her sons help her to take care of the garden when they come to Imishli in the summer. They are students and study in Baku. 

Gulnar applied for a 1500AZN loan in order to pay for her sons' educational and daily costs while they stay in Baku because life in the capital is very expensive, especially for poor families.

loans.use: to pay for her sons' monthly educational fee and daily costs

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba is an honest woman. She was born in 1979. She is living in the northern part of a country in a village. She is a widow and has three children. 

Mahbuba has a business of keeping livestock and planting cotton. She has a dream to open a farm with livestock. She hopes that, with the support of Kiva, she will be close to her dream. 

She is asking for a 2000 TJS loan for buying cattle. Mahbuba awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Mailyn

texts.en:
Mailyn is a 33-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. She is from Carles, Iloilo. She has been running a fishing business with her husband for more than 20 years now. This is their main source of income.

Mailyn is asking to take a loan to buy a new fishing boat and fishing nets. This loan will help her and her husband to improve their fishing business as well as their income.

In the future, Mailyn hopes to expand their fishing business so that it will become more productive and stable. She also wants to save money for the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat and fishing nets

loans.name: Umeda

texts.en: Umeda is a conscientious woman. She was born in 1988. She is from the northern part of the country. She is living in a village. She is single and lives with her parents. Umeda is an agrarian woman. She plants agricultural products like cotton and keeps livestock. She is planning to open a farm to keep cattle in the future. Umeda is asking for financial support from the Kiva project to buy horned cattle. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy horned cattle.

loans.name: Margin

texts.en:
Margin is a 50-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She is from Carles, Iloilo. She has been running a fishing business with her husband for more than 19 years now. Fishing is a very lucrative business in their place.

Margin is requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, floaters, outriggers, and other fishing gear. A loan will help her and her husband to improve their fishing business as well as their income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, floaters, outriggers, and other fishing gear

loans.name: Umriniso

texts.en:
Umriniso is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1968 and lives in the northern part of the country. She is married and has four children. She has a business of planting agricultural products and keeping livestock.

Umriniso is a goal-oriented, responsible and honest person. She is planning to open a cattle farm for the future. She is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to buy cattle. She hopes to be supported and awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Ralyn

texts.en:
Ralyn is a 43-year-old married woman living in Carles, Iloilo. She is the mother of three grown children and has been running a fishing business with her husband for more than three years now.

Ralyn would like to take a loan to buy new fishing nets and lead weights. This loan will surely help Ralyn and her husband in improving their fishing business.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and lead weights

loans.name: Guram

texts.en:
Guram, who is a 28-year-old married man, lives in the village of Charnali. He lives with his mother, wife, and little daughter. Their salary is not enough to meet all basic needs and daily costs of the family. 

With the help of his family members, Guram is extensively engaged in agribusiness, which is the most important source of his family's income. For several years already, Guram has been involved in the cultivation of seasonal citrus and fruits. They sell the agricultural products in the local market. 

As it becomes harder to earn a living over time, Guram wants to expand his agribusiness in order to more effectively meet the daily costs of the family. A loan of 2200 GEL will be a great support to this hard-working man and his family, enabling him to purchase stocks of fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices to trade door-to-door through his region. 

Guram and his family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will highly appreciate their support.

loans.use: to trade fruits and vegetables and expand his business .

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is a 45-year-old married woman and mother of nine children. She lives with her family in Carles, Iloilo, where she and her husband are engaged in fishing. This has been the source of their income for the past 20 years, while Marites also owns a small sari-sari store. She has requested a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and more items to sell in her store, including canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and condiments. This loan will allow Marites to improve her business as well as increase her income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and more stocks for the store like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and condiments

loans.name: Rea

texts.en:
Rea, 41, is a sari-sari store owner from Carles, Iloilo. She is married and has eight children. Rea has operated her sari-sari or retail store for more than 12 years now. This is her source of income. 

Rea is asking to take a loan to buy more stocks for her store, such as rice, canned goods, noodles, soap, toiletries, condiments, cooking oil, and other items. A loan will help her improve her inventories, thus attracting more buyers to her store. 

In the future, Rea hopes of making her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more stocks for her store, such as rice, canned goods, noodles, soap, toiletries, condiments, cooking oil, and other items.

loans.name: Nick

texts.en:
Nick is a 29-year-old fisherman from Carles, Iloilo. He has been in the fishing business for more than two years now. In the photo, Nick is sitting next to crab cages or traps.

Nick is asking to take a loan to buy a new fishing boat and ropes. A loan will help improve his business as well as his income.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat and ropes

loans.name: Leydy Orbelicia

texts.es:
Leydy, de 41 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada y su esposo se dedica a la venta de minutas, también su hijo en los ratos libre hace la misma actividades.

Leydy, se dedica a la venta de minutas desde hace 9 años, la aprendió de una amiga y le gusto y decidio dedicarse a eso, ella se trasporta en una bicicleta a la orilla de la playa, a vender al igual que su esposo y su hijo.

El crédito sera utilizado para comprar una bicicleta, para equiparla para la venta de minutas y comprar un equipo de pesca.

Los sueños de Leydy, son mejorar su vivienda y comprar una lancha con su equipo.
texts.en:
Leydy, 41, has a ninth grade education and she is married. Her husband sells shaved ice snacks for a living, and her son also helps out in his spare time. 

Leydy has been selling shaved ice snacks for the past nine years, which she learned from a friend. She enjoyed it and decided to make a living from it. She travels by bicycle to the shoreline of the beach to sell them, just like her husband and her son.

The loan will be used to buy a bicycle to equip her for selling the shaved ice snacks and to buy fishing gear.

Leydy's dreams are to improve her home and to buy a boat with the equipment

loans.use: to buy a bicycle.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 36-year-old married woman. She is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hands. Her skill is known throughout the town.

She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads, and frames to meet orders of her customers on time and to earn good profits. This monetary help can take Saima closer to her dream of providing a quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, and frames to meet orders of her customers on time and earn good profits.

loans.name: Ghulam  Fatima

texts.en:
Ghulam Fatima is a 45-year-old married woman. She is the mother of 5 children. She has been doing a business of animal sales and purchasing for many years. Ghulam Fatima earns good amount of income to contribute in the family income.

She has requested a loan of 40000 PKR. She wants to use this loan to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to re-sell in the market.

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en:
Naheed is a 37-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. Her husband also helps her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market, and she deals with customers in her store. She is a mother of three children and wants to provide them all basic necessities including food, clothing, health, and education. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages in order to boost her earnings. She is expecting that this loan will be a productive one for her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages in order to boost her earnings.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 54-year-old married woman. She is the mother of 5 children. She has been doing a business of animal sales and purchasing for many years. She fully supports her family through her work. 

Now, she has requested a loan of 45000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improving her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Shareefan

texts.en: Shareefan is 52 years old, married and has earned a living for many years by buying and selling animals with the help of her husband. Her business has provided her family, including her two children, with a decent life. She is very motivated to provide her entire family with a beautiful life, a good education, food and clothing. She has requested a loan for 40,000 PKR to buy more baby goats and calves to sell to her customers and hopes that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to buy more baby goats and calves.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is a 41-year-old married woman and the mother of four children, from Carles, Iloilo. She is engaged in the fishing business with her husband. This is the source of their income. Analyn is asking to take a loan to buy more new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and a boat engine. This loan will help them improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Analyn dreams of making their fishing business more sustainable and profitable. She also wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and a boat engine

loans.name: Leida Edith

texts.es:
Portoviejo es la capital de la provincia de Manabí en Ecuador. Conocida por ser la primera ciudad ecuatoriana más antigua asentada en la región costanera,  está  ganando terreno en el turismo ya que este cantón posee playa, ciudad y campo.
En este lugar vive la señora Leida,  tiene 51  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 5 hijos de los cuales 4 mayores de edad e independientes y uno de 17 años que estudia en tercero bachillerato. Su esposo es albañil, viven en casa propia.
Doña Leida para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar  hace varios años empezó un negocio, ella lava ropa ajena  en su casa de lunes a viernes,  los sábados y domingos se dedica a la venta de morcillas (tripa de puerco rellena de arroz y sangre, condimentada por algunos ingredientes), la morcilla es un plato típico manabita. Trabaja con la ayuda de la hermana pero la señora Leida es quien atiende y prepara este plato.  Su negocio lo tiene más de 2 años en su casa y como hasta el momento le va muy bien  piensa agrandar su local.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar  arroz, tripa de cerdo y otros víveres. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 6 años  y le gusta porque es muy unido el grupo y por todos los beneficios que le da la fundación.  Su sueño es mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Portoviejo is the capital of the province of Manabí in Ecuador. It is known for being the first, historic Ecuadorian city established on the coastal region. It is gaining ground in tourism since this region has beaches, a city and the countryside. This is where Leida lives. 

She is 51 years old, married and she has five children from this relationship, four of which are adults and live independently. One of them is seventeen years old and is in the third year of high school. Her husband is a construction worker and they live in their own home.

To help her husband with the household expenses, Leida started a business some years ago. She washes other people's clothing in her home from Monday to Friday. On Saturdays and Sundays she sells blood sausage (pork belly filled with rice and blood, seasoned with other ingredients). Blood sausage is a typical dish of Manabí. 

Her sister helps with the work, but Leida is the one who looks after and prepares the dish. Her business has been in her home for more than two years and since it has been going well so far, she is thinking of enlarging her store.

This loan will be used to buy rice, pork belly and other supplies. She has been in the communal bank for six years and she likes it, because the group is very united and also because of the benefits the foundation gives. Her dream is to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy rice, pork belly and supplies.

loans.name: Isidora

texts.en:
Isidora is a businesswoman who earns by selling various items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC, and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. 

Recently she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks for house repair. 

She is on her way to renovating her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

location.town: Ozamis-P2 Gango, Ozamiz City, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Naneth

texts.en:
Naneth is 45 years old, married and a resident of Villaflor, Oroquieta City, Philippines. 

Naneth operates a "sari-sari" (General Store) business with a starting capitalization of 4,000 PHP. Naneth applied her membership with PMPC during March of 2013 and had her first loan to start her business. She was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. 

Now, Naneth is applying for 11,000 PHP to buy additional goods for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities. She wants to restock canned goods, milk, noodles, sugar, oil and soy sauce for retail.  

In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart, and will be fully satisfied if she sees all of her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional goods for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz is 62 years old. She is known in the Aguada area for her sari-sari store. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers. She hopes to live comfortably with a decent house. She has applied for a loan to purchase hollow blocks and cement for house repair.  She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority, as a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for; all her financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase hollowblocks and cement for house repair

loans.name: Francisca Olivia

texts.es:
Francisca, de 58 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, es madre soltera de  4 hijos,  3 que están vivos y una hija murió cuando tenía 5 años de edad.

Francisca,  se ha dedicado a los oficios domésticos y a hacer petates para jalar maíz y maicillo.- También a vendido tálales, pan y otros antojitos.- Esto lo ha hecho, con el fin de darle lo necesario a sus hijos.   

El crédito lo ocupara para comprar un tratamiento médico, porque está padeciendo de la vesícula y con el resto del dinero comprará materiales para elaborar hamacas, porque también conoce de este trabajo. 

Francisca, desea que su negocio de elaborar hamacas vaya creciendo.
texts.en:
Francisca is 58 years old and studied through the first grade. She is a single mother of four children. Three of her children are living and one daughter died at the age of 5.

Francisca takes care of the household chores and makes woven mats for drying corn and sorghum. She also sells tamales, bread, and other snack foods. Francisca does all of this so that she can provide what her children need.

The loan will be used to buy a medical treatment because she is concerned about her gallbladder. The rest of the money will be used to buy materials for making hammocks since she is knowledgeable about this type of work. Francisca wants to grow her hammock-making business.

loans.use: to purchase a medical treatment remedy and materials for making hammocks.

loans.name: Sherzod

texts.ru:
Шерзод мужчина в возрасте 30 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. У него среднее образование, почти что 6 лет занимается откормом скота. Шерзод  занимается животноводством и земледелием,  но также зарабатывает разнорабочим себе и семье  на проживание. Он очень  хороший , добрый  и в своей  семье  любящий муж.  Он очень стремительный и трудолюбивый 
В данное время Шерзод хочет отремонтировать свой дом, где будут хорошие условия для проживания. Для этого Шерзод обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для ремонта дома. Он  надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Sherzod is a 30-year-old man. He is married and has two children. He has a secondary education and has been involved in fattening up livestock for almost 6 years. Sherzod is involved in animal husbandry and farming, but also earns a living for himself and his family as a laborer. He is a very good, kind and loving husband in his family. He is very driven and hardworking.

At the present time, Sherzod wants to repair his house in order to create good living conditions there. This is why Sherzod came to Arvand and wants to obtain a loan to buy construction materials to repair his house. He hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair his house

loans.name: Mussarat

texts.en:
Mussarat is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing merchandise for her store from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is the mother of eight children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health.

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to efficiently handle increasing customer demand. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings for expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to efficiently handle increasing customer demand.

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en: Ny’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Ny makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Hakim

texts.en:
Hakim is a 43-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. She has been running a tailoring business for many years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet their household expenses as well as the educational needs of their children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well.

Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more reels of threads and packs of buttons, ribbons and laces so that she can meet orders on time. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Hakim hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads and packs of buttons, ribbons and laces so that she can meet orders on time.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en: Salima is very kind and wise woman. She is 43 years old. She lives with her husband and 4 children. Salima has been engaged in animal husbandry from childhood. She learned this kind of activity from her parents. She likes her work because she gets a good income from it. Currently Salima wants to increase the quantity of her livestock and improve her business. Her main difficulty is a lack of money. That`s why she applied for a loan from Humo. Salima really needs your support.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a car.

loans.name: Dee-Ann

texts.en: Dee-Ann is a resident of Carles, Iloilo. She is married and has nine children. The eldest is 19 and the youngest is 2.
