Mary is requesting a loan to buy fishing materials such as fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, etc. A loan will help Mary and her husband to improve their fishing business. 

Mary hopes to expand their business in the future so they can generate more income.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, etc.

loans.name: Alda

texts.pt:
A Sr. Alda de 52 anos de idade casada e mae de 5 filhos dos quais 2 sao independentes e 3 estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario. Ela  è negociante  informal de produtos da machamba repolho, feijao verde, tomate, cebola e mais diversos produtos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado na compra de material de construcao (blocos, cimentos, pedra, janelas e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construcao da sua casa.
Tem como grande desafio melhorar as condcoes de habitacao, a dieta almentar e continuar a trabalhar com fundos da Hluvuku-Adsema.
texts.en:
Alda is 52 years old and married. She has five children, two of whom are independent and three attend primary and secondary school. She's an informal trader of farm produce such as cabbage, green beans, tomatoes, onions and various other products.
This loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (bricks, cement, rocks, window frames) and to pay for labor. That way she'll continue building her house.
Her great challenge is to improve her living conditions and her diet, and also to continue working with loans from Hluvuku-Adsema.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (bricks, cement, rocks, window frames) and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man. He describes himself as trustworthy. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, salt, beans, and flour, along with other items. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. 

Peter's business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be seasonal changes. He will use his 30,000 KES loan to buy more inventory of flour, sugar, salt, as well as other grocery items. 

Peter hopes that, in the future, he will expand his business. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, and his previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of flour, sugar, salt, as well as other grocery items.

loans.name: Exaltación De La Cruz

texts.es:
Exaltación, de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casado y su esposa le ayuda en el negocio de venta de especias, cuando el trabaja de albañil, tiene 3 hijos que aún van a la escuela.

Exaltación, vende específicamente especias como: comino, canela, chan. Pimienta, achote, etc, su padre le enseño este negocio ya que toda su familia trabajan de esta manera, el negocio lo tiene en el centro de su municipio, viaja en micro-bus y sus hijos y esposa le apoyan en su negocio.
  
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar especias al por mayor para su negocio y de esa forma mejorará sus ingresos.

El sueño de Exaltación, es tener su negocio y que le genere  mejores ingresos, para poder mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Exaltación is 45 years old. He studied through sixth grade. He is married, and his wife helps him with his spice sale business when he works as a bricklayer. He has three children, who are still in school.

Exaltación specifically sells spices such as cumin, cinnamon, pepper, achiote, etc. His father taught him this business, since his entire family performs this work. His business is located in the center of the city. He travels there by microbus, and his children and wife help support the business.

He is requesting a loan to buy spices at wholesale for his business so that, in this way, he can improve his income. His dream is to continue with his business and to have it generate a better income for him to maintain his family.

loans.use: to buy spices at wholesale for his business.

loans.name: Maria  Del Carmen

texts.es: Maria de 48 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo y su padre, ella se dedica desde hace 10 años a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz, frijol, tomates y hortalizas, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la comercializa en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, ya tiene muchos clientes fijos, Maria está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria is 48 years old. She is a single mother, and she lives in her own house with her son and her father. For the past 10 years, she has made a living in agriculture, cultivating corn, beans, tomatoes, and vegetables. When her crops are ready, she sells them at the different markets that are near her house. She has many regular customers.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, composts, pesticides, herbicides, etc. and to improve her land, which is shown in the photograph. She wishes to continue with her harvests, since they are her only source of work, in order to obtain a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, composts, pesticides, herbicides, etc. and to improve her land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seafood to sell.

loans.name: Roberth

texts.es:
Roberth, de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar, son padres de dos hijos, los cuales no asisten a la escuela por que todavía no tienen la edad.

Roberth, es agricultor, actividad que realiza desde que era muy pequeño, ya que no continuo  sus estudios porque tenia que trabajar para ayudar a sus padres, además de la agricultura también trabaja en un molino que compro y también trabaja junto a su padre en la agricultura.

Roberth, utilizara el préstamo para comprar productos como gas propano, tarjetas de telefonía y venta de recargas electrónicas, ya que en la zona donde reside no hay venta de estos productos.

El sueño de Roberth, es que el negocio que va a iniciar, pueda mantenerse y crecer, también sueña,  mas adelante poder ampliar el negocio.
texts.en:
Roberth, who is 28 years old, went to school through sixth grade. He is married, and his wife does the household tasks. They are parents of two children, who don't go to school because they are still not old enough.

Roberth is a farmer. He has been doing this work since he was very young, since he didn't continue his studies because he had to work to help his parents. In addition to agriculture, he also works in a mill that he bought, and he also works with his father in agriculture.

Roberth will use the loan to buy products to sell, such as propane gas, telephone cards, and electronic recharges, since in the zone where he lives there are no sales of these products.

Roberth's dream is that the business that he is going to begin can maintain itself and grow. He also drams of being able to expand the business in the future.

loans.use: to buy products such as propane gas, telephone cards, and electronic re-charges to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman. She has 6 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 12 years. She describes herself to be hardworking. She operates a retail business where she sells omena ( small type of fish). She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy market and her primary customers are regular. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.en:
Demetrio is 62-years-old and he lives in El Alto. Demetrio has an interesting job - he is a "Yatiri."  Therefore, Demetrio is some kind of wizard that gives his services to many people that need protection for their families of their business. That is because in Bolivia many people believe in the power of the Aymara culture and its rites so there are Aymara witches and Aymara warlocks that give this service.  For instance, they make blessing rites for any kind of business.

Demetrio has worked in this field since many years ago and he needs a loan to buy items to prepare blessing rites, amulets and other spells. Demetrio has a son and he is training him in the arts of Andean witchcraft.  He hopes you can help him because the magic he practices is good.  The main purpose is to help and protect.

loans.use: to buy items to prepare blessing rites, amulets and other spells

loans.name: Shovkat

texts.en:
Shovkat is a 63-year-old single woman. She has been working as a seller in a product market for 43 years. She has had a hard life and has to earn money for family and to help her parents. Now she is alone and lives in the Agsu region. She works all day long and her monthly income is only 190 AZN. She sells bread, butter, water, sweets, gum, etc. but her earnings don't cover life's demands. 

Now Shovkat needs money for repairing her flat because it's old and cold. Her monthly income isn't enough for that and she can hardly use it for daily needs. She applied for a 1500 AZN loan in order to make a master room and make renovations to her flat. She wants to make her place more cozy and warm and hopes that this money will meet the repairing demands.

loans.use: to make a master room and make renovations to her flat

loans.name: Jonela

texts.en: Jonela is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a business with her husband for more than 10 years now. Jonela is asking to take a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, outriggers and other items. This loan will help Jonela and her husband in improving their business as well as their income. Jonela dreams of improving their livelihood in the future. She also wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, outriggers and other items

loans.name: Welfreda

texts.en: Welfreda is a sari-sari store owner from Talibon, Bohol. She has been in this business for more than 20 years now. Welfreda is asking to take a loan to buy more groceries like noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, candies, bread and biscuits among other items. This loan will be a great help for her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, candies, bread and biscuits among other items

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana is a 37-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in the fishing business with her husband for more than 20 years now. She also earns an additional income through snack food vending. Susana is asking to take a loan to buy new fishing nets. A loan will help her and her husband improve their fishing business as well as their income. Susana’s future dreams include the expansion of their business and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Getafe, Bohol. She is engaged in a farming business and bamboo retail ventures. Bamboo is used as one material in making houses. 

Merlinda is asking to take a loan to buy more bamboos to sell. In the future, Merlinda hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a dairy farm where she keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in an area fit for business and her primary customers are the general public. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for grocery items, vegetables, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Sima

texts.en:
Sima is a 50-year-old pensioner. She is married and has a daughter and a son. Sima is a gardener because the harvest from the garden brings the family more earnings than her pension. Sima raises and sells to neighbours and local bazaars. Her husband helps her to sell the harvest at the local bazaar too and earn more money for family. They have a small garden and raise tere apples, pears, pomegranates and some vegetables. 

Sima's income from gardening is only 190 AZN monthly. Sima loves her garden very much and takes proper care of it. She applied for 1500 AZN loan in order to build greenhouse for her garden and to keep plants warm during cold winters. She hopes that this will help her to rise the productivity of her garden and income of her family because her salary and pension don't meet the family's demands.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse for her garden and to keep plants warm during winter

loans.name: Ivan De Jesus

texts.es: Iván, tiene 31 años de edad, esta casado, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, y reside en una aldea que pertenece al Municipio de Gracias, Lempira. El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura con su familia, hace 7 años tiene cultivo de café, el cual vende en grano en oro y seco.  Esta actividad es su única fuente de ingresos para la familia. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para compra de abonos y fertilizar su finca de café con el propósito de mejorar la cosecha y obtener mejor ganancias. Tiene planes de ampliar el cultivo, sembrar una manzana mas de café.
texts.en:
Iván is 31 years old. He is married. He lives with his wife and their three children in a small village that belongs to the township of Gracias, Lempira. He has always worked in agriculture with his family. For seven years he has had a planting of coffee, which he sells dried and unhulled. This business is his only source of income for the family.

He has applied for a loan of 10,000 lempiras for the purchase of compost to fertilize his coffee farm with the goal of improving the harvest and obtaining better earnings. He has plans to expand his plantings, planting one more manzana [1.74 acres] of coffee.

loans.use: to buy compost to fertilize his coffee planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain his surveying work team so he can carry out the projects assigned to him

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
María, ha desarrolla diferentes actividades durante toda su vida, como: cultivo de árboles frutales, venta de semilla de marañón, antojitos y prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros, niños y niñas, para obtener recursos necesarios para subsistir junto a su familia, ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos de 44 y 39 años de edad, no tiene personas dependientes, algunas actividades las aprendió con su familia y otras por iniciativa propia, el negocio lo desempeña sola en algunas actividades tiene que contratar obreros para que le ayuden, no representa dificultades en la realización de sus actividades. La foto fue tomada mientras realizaba la venta de antojitos frente a su vivienda. 
El préstamo lo necesitara para comprar sacos, matates, lazos, pailas de aluminio, sombreros, alambre de púas y reparara las básculas, tendrá equipo para realizar los trabajos de recolección de fruta, espera mejorar la rentabilidad de su negocio y tener una situación económica estable.
Para María es importante lograr mantener el negocio con vida para generar ingresos con los que cancelara su deuda, tendrá un mejor estilo de vida familiar y remodelara su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria has developed various businesses during her lifetime, such as raising fruit trees and selling cashew nuts, snacks, and articles of clothing for women, men, boys and girls in order to obtain the necessary resources to survive along with her family. She is single and has two children, ages 44 and 39. She has no dependents. She learned some businesses with her family and others on her own initiative. She carries out some businesses alone, and in others she has to hire workers to help her. It does not present any difficulties in carrying out her businesses. The photo was taken while she was selling snacks in front of her house.

She needs the loan to buy sacks, canvas bags, ties, aluminum pots, hats, and barbed wire, to repair the scales, and to have staff to do the work of harvesting the fruit. She hopes to improve the profitability of her business and have a more stable economic situation.

For Maria, it's important to manage to keep the business going in order to generate income with which she will repay her debt. She will have a better family life style and will remodel her house.

loans.use: to buy sacks, canvas bags, ties, aluminum pots, hats, and barbed wire, to repair the scales, and to have staff to do the work of harvesting the fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to do maintenance on his sand truck and fulfill his dream of having a family.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Don Manuel, tiene 62 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja,  vive en una aldea de Petoa, Santa Bárbara junto a un hijo. Siempre trabajó en la agricultura y hace 10 años decidió con su esposa establecer una pulpería para vender granos básicos, carnes, embutidos, refrescos, churros dulces etc. Ha obtenido varios préstamos para el negocio, con el actual son once ciclos y es por 5,000 lempiras para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, carnes, embutidos y refrescos. Su plan es aumentar el inventario, comprar productos nuevos que ofrecer y en un futuro le gustaría comprar ganado.
texts.en:
Manuel is 62 years old and lives with his partner in a village in Petoa, Santa Barbara, along with a son.

He always worked in agriculture, and 10 years ago he decided, along with his wife, to start a grocery store to sell basic grains, meat, cold cuts, soda, churros, etc.

He has obtained various loans for the business. This current one is his 11th loan cycle, and it is for 5,000 lempiras to buy products like rice, sugar, meat, cold cuts, and soda.

His plan is to expand the inventory and buy new products to offer, and in the future he would like buy livestock.

loans.use: to buy products like rice, sugar, meat, cold cuts, and soda to sell

loans.name: Leonardo Antonio

texts.es: Don Leonardo, tiene  52 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos y reside con su familia en un sector que pertenece a Cofradía, Cortes.  Don Leonardo se dedicaba a la agricultura y en busca de obtener mejores ingresos para la familia decidió con su esposa poner una pulpería la cual lleva cinco años de funcionar y la ha sostenido mediante préstamos. En el negocio vende arroz, azúcar, pan, manteca, frijoles, churros, refrescos, huevos, productos de aseo y otros abarrotes. Actualmente solicita otro prestamo por 14,000 Lempiras para surtir de más productos como azúcar, frijoles, arroz, manteca, pan, huevos, refrescos, y productos de aseo.   Su meta es estabilizar su economía y llegar a ser abarrotería bien surtida.
texts.en:
Leonardo is 52 years old and married. He has two children and lives with his family in an area of Cofradía, Cortes.

Leonardo used to work in farming and wanted to make more income for his family. With his wife, he decided to start a grocery store that has now been in operation for 5 years. He has maintained it through loans.

The store sells rice, sugar, bread, butter, beans, churros, soda, eggs, personal care products, and other essentials. He is requesting another loan for 14,000 lempiras to stock more products like sugar, beans, rice, butter, bread, eggs, soda, and personal care products.

His goal is to stabilize his economic situation and become a well-stocked grocery store.

loans.use: to stock his business with products like sugar, beans, rice, butter, bread, eggs, soda, and personal care products.

loans.name: Taytacha Señor De Ccoyllority De Yungaqui Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “TAYTACHA SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia es la Sra. Canisia ella es soltera y tiene 51 años y tiene 9 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que por medio de su pequeño trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas. 

La socia que estan pegada a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
Este préstamo es parte de una de las líneas de crédito de la Asociación Arariwa su nombre es Credi Yapa, esta línea de crédito es otorgado a los prestatarios con buen historial crediticio, siendo este un grupo que cumple dichas características.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de ganaderia, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de agricultura. La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “TAYTACHA SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI” communal bank which is located in the district of Anta belonging to the province of Anta, Cusco Province.

Canisia is 51 years old, single and has 9 children. She works in her business of raising and selling animals. She raises guinea pigs and chickens, fattens them and then sells them in the different markets. She is an enterprising and hard-working woman who through her modest work brought up her children. Her dream is to have a location to sell her guinea pigs and chickens.

She is requesting a loan to buy chickens and guinea pigs and food for them. The member whose photo is inserted had her picture taken after the meeting as she asked for permission to arrive late due to her work commitments. This loan is part of the line of loans from the Asociación Arariwa which are called Credi Yapa. These loans are given to the borrowers who have a good credit history, and this is a group that meets those requirements.

The other members work selling animals, raising cattle, a grocery store, and a farm business. The member thanks those who form part of this dream by bay of this loan and promises to pay her installments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens and food for them.

loans.name: Khavar

texts.en:
Khavar is a 50-year-old single woman. She lives alone in the Agsu region. She is farmer and has a small piece of land where she raises seasonal fruits and crops. She then sells the harvest to the local bazaars. 

Khavar has worked in agriculture for 30 years and earns 170 AZN monthly. She is a well experienced and hardworking woman. Khavar has applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to supply good equipment for her agriculture business to collect crops from her land. 

She wants to expand her small business and open a farm in future.

loans.use: to supply equipment for agriculture for crop collection.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda, 44, is a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. Married to Richard, a security guard, she has one child who is still in the Elementary Level in school. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs and to send her child to school. 

Brenda has a tourist boat business. Coron island is one of the most popular tourist spot in the Philippines. It has the best diving and snorkeling site and is a favorite among the local and foreign tourists. Most island hopping is concentrated in Coron. Brenda rents out her boat to tourists who wants to go island hopping. She earns a minimum of Php 1,000 a day from her boat rental.

To help her continue operations she is requesting a Php 25,000 loan which she will use to pay for the maintenance of her tourist boat. It is important that her boat is always in a good condition to ensure the safety and enjoyment of her passengers. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. It will surely help in their daily sustenance and for her child's education.

Brenda hopes to maintain and grow her business so she could give her family a better life. She strives to give her child the best education possible and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and this is a place where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her tourist boat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Joaquin Elias

texts.es:
Joaquín, es una persona que se dedica a vender plátanos al mayoreo y práctica la crianza de ganado, tiene 46 años de edad, es casado y su esposa tiene 45 años de edad, han procreado dos hijos de 12 y 15 años de edad, trabaja todos los días sin un horario establecido, el negocio es familiar y lo inicio hace más de 15 años, hasta la fecha no representa dificultades en el negocio.
Invertirá en ganado y en plátanos, mejorara el negocio, espera incrementar su inventario y ganancias con las cuales podrá cancelar su deuda y cubrir las necesidades de su familia. 
Sus sueños son continuar trabajando para generar recursos económicos para dar a su familia un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Joaquín makes a living selling bananas in bulk and breeding animals. He is a 46-year old married man who, together with his 45-year old wife, has 2 children, ages 12 and 15. He works everyday with no schedule. This is a family business and he has run it for over 15 years without any difficulty. 

He plans to invest in livestock and bananas, to improve the business, to increase stock and to improve income, so that he can cancel his debt and cover family needs. His dream is to keep working and to generate enough income to provide his family with a better future.

loans.use: to invest in livestock and bananas to improve his business.

loans.name: Ruhumba Women Group

texts.en:
The Ruhumba Women’s group is found in a Ruhumba trading center. The group is comprised of mainly men and women who are involved in small-scale trade and simple agriculture.

Abias is a 38-year-old widowed mother with three children; two of her children are in school. Abias sells groceries, such as yellow bananas, and second-hand clothes on a small scale from which she earns income to cater for her family's basic needs. Her business is displayed in a small shop along the main road of Ibanda-Mbarara in Ruhumba, where she has the challenges of smaller capital and competition with others. 

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings to help her add more stock of yellow bananas, mangoes and oranges for her business and also pay school fees for her children. 

Abias is an honest and hardworking lady and hopes, if given support, she will be in a position to keep the business growing and meet the family needs, as well. She appreciates her fellow group members, Ugafode and Kiva lenders for the great vision of alleviating poverty. She hopes to get future loans.

loans.use: to buy yellow bananas and fruits to sell

loans.name: Agashirin

texts.en:
Agashirin is a 54-year-old farmer. He is married and has two sons. His wife is a housekeeper and takes care of the family. Agashirin is a very responsible farmer. He has been working in the agriculture sector for two years and became well experienced in this area. He raises seasonal fruits, vegetables and some kinds of crops. He has a big piece of land, and his sons support and help him in this hard work. Aghashirin raises and sells his harvest to local bazaars, and together with his sons, he supplies his harvest to different parts of the region. 

Aghashirin enlarges his farm productivity in different ways, and one of them is a new piece of land. He has bought a piece of land and planted crops there. Now he needs to install an irrigational system to raise the harvest properly. He applied for an 1,100 AZN loan in order to install this system on the land. He is a very perceptive farmer and plans to expand his farm in the near future.

loans.use: to install an irrigational system to raise the harvest properly

loans.name: Khayala

texts.en:
Khayala is a 31-year-old woman. She is married and has a son and a daughter. Her children are scholars, and her husband is a taxi driver. He works day and night in order to provide for his family. 

Khayala was a housekeeper, but nine years ago, she started to earn money for the family working as a hairstyle master. She became an experienced master and has many clients. She doesn't work in a beauty salon; she attends her customers visiting their houses. Her monthly income is 180 AZN, but this money doesn't cover her needs. 

Khayala loves her family very much. She does everything and works hard in order to provide them with good education and happy childhoods. 

Khayala applied for a 1,000 AZN loan in order to buy new equipment for hairstyling because her old one is out of order and can do harm.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for hairstyling

loans.name: Sadiq

texts.en:
Sadiq is a 43-year-old married man. His wife is a housekeeper, and they have a son and two daughters. Sadiq is a farmer. He keeps and fattens cows and then sells their milk or meat at a local bazaar. His wife helps him; she makes yoghurt and cheese from milk. His son supports him, too. Sadiq has been working as a farmer for 15 years. He has good experience and earns 190 AZN monthly. 

Sadiq is a very hardworking man, and he tries to provide his children and wife a good life, but his income doesn't meet the life demands because life in Azerbaijan is very expensive. Though husbandry is in high demand, the income from it is low. 

The house where Sadiq lives with his family is old, and he slowly makes changes and renovations to the house from year to year. Now Sadiq has applied for a 1,200 AZN loan in order to repair the water system and water tank in his house.

loans.use: to repair the water system and water tank in his house

loans.name: Vesile

texts.en:
Vesile is a 43-year-old trader. She is married and has a son and two daughters. Her husband is trader, too. They keep land and raise their crops to sell them at local bazaar. Her monthly income from selling is only 175 AZN.  

Vesile is a very kind, warm, hardworking and responsible woman. Together with her husband, she has been collecting money for a long time and finally has bought an additional piece of land in order to increase productivity. Now Vesile has applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to buy a supply of new seeds for crops to raise on the new land. She plans to increase her harvest and her income from crop selling.

loans.use: to buy a supply of new seeds for crops to raise on new land

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Alba, de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja en la agricultura y no tienen hijos. 

Alba, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, pero también le ayuda a su pareja en la siembra de maíz y maicillo, este trabajo lo aprendió con su papá, ellos además de dedicarse a la agricultura, también tienen una granja de gallinas, para tener ingresos extras y no tener que depender solo de su pareja.- 
Alba, se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. porque tiene que darles de comer a las gallinas y a los cerdos que tiene, para luego ir con su esposo a sembrar, trabajan 6 horas al día y para llegar hasta donde tienen los cultivos tienen que caminar 1 kilómetro. 

El crédito sera utilizado para compra semilla, abono, veneno y herbicidas. 

El sueño de Alba es tener una tienda y comprar unas tres vacas lecheras.
texts.en:
Alba is 35 years old and studied through the ninth grade. She is in a relationship and her partner works in agriculture. They have no children.

Alba takes care of the household duties, but she also helps her partner with planting corn and sorghum. She learned this type of work from her father. In addition to working in agriculture, Alba and her partner have a poultry farm in order to generate extra income. She doesn't want to rely solely on her partner.

Alba wakes up at 4:30 A.M. in order to feed the chickens and pigs. Later on, she helps her husband with the farming. They work for six hours and must walk one kilometer in order to reach their crops. Her loan will be used to buy seeds, compost, poisons, and herbicides.

Alba dreams of having a store and buying three dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, poisons, and herbicides.

loans.name: Essohanam

texts.fr: Essohanam est une femme mariée et âgée de 33 ans. Essohanam vit à Avédji avec ses cinq enfants et exerce son activité pour subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de la famille. Essohanam vend des charbons de bois. Essohanam s’approvisionne au marché deux fois par mois. Essohanam demande ce prêt pour acheter des charbons de bois qu’elle pourra revendre à ses clients et avoir une bonne rentabilité et aider ses enfants à s’épanouir.
texts.en:
Essohanam is a 33-year-old, married woman.  She lives in Avédji with her five children and works to support her family.  Essohanam sells charcoal.  She buys her supplies twice a month from the market.

Essohanam has requested this loan to buy further supplies of charcoal which she will sell to her customers.  She expects to make a good profit and help her children to thrive.

loans.use: to buy 33 sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Alejandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Alejandra, se dedica a vender ropa y calzado, es una joven soltera que aún vive con su madre y hermanos, la casa pertenece a su madre, el negocio lo tiene bajo su responsabilidad desde hace tres años, aprendió a realizarlo a una edad temprana cuando acompañaba a su madre vender, no presenta dificultades en su negocio en este momento.
Para tener más mercadería solicita capital para comprar ropa, faldas, camisas, vestidos, camisones, etc., de esa manera mantendrá su negocio actualizado con los cambios de la moda, con la inversión busca tener a sus clientes satisfechos y una fuente de ingresos fija.
Sus sueños son tener un negocio más grande, cancelar la deuda adquirida y trabajar solo con capital propio.
texts.en:
Alejandra makes a living selling clothing and footwear. Alejandra is a single young woman who still lives with her mother and siblings in a house that belongs to her mother. Alejandra has been responsible for this business for three years, having learned how to manage it at a young age when she helped her mother to sell products. Alejandra does not currently have any problems with the business.

In order to buy more merchandise, Alejandra is applying for a loan that she will use to buy clothes, skirts, shirts, dresses, nightgowns and more to keep her business up-to-date with the latest fashions. Alejandra hopes that this investment will allow her to have more satisfied customers and a fixed income.

Alejandra’s dream is to have a bigger business, pay off her debt, and work using her own capital.

loans.use: to buy clothes, skirts, shirts, dresses, nightgowns and more in order to keep her business up-to-date with the latest fashions.

loans.name: Hilda Antonia

texts.es: Doña Hilda, tiene 52 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Barbara, junto a una hija. Hace tres años que decidió tener su propio negocio para vender productos alimenticios como granos básicos, harina, manteca, café, pan, refrescos, churros, lácteos etc. Su idea es mantener surtido su negocio y ha decidido solicitar un prestamo por 20,000 lempiras para comprar azúcar, refrescos, maíz, frijoles,  y carnes para vender. Con esta inversión espera mejorar sus ventas e ingresos para hacer crecer el negocio y darle mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en: Hilda is 52 years old and a single mother. She has two children and lives in the municipality of Azacualpa, in Santa Barbara with one of her daughters. Three years ago, Hilda decided to start her own business selling food products, such as basic grains, flour, coffee, bread, soft drinks, churros, dairy products, and more. Hilda wants to keep her business stocked up and has therefore decided to apply for a loan of 20,000 Lempira in order to buy sugar, soft drinks, corn, beans, and meats to sell. Hilda hopes that this investment will allow her to increase her sales and income so that she can expand her business and give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soft drinks, corn, beans, and meats to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Houndjenko

texts.fr: Agée de 51 ans, Houndjenko est une femme mariée et mère de deux enfants. Houndjenko habite à Attiégou et vend des produits alimentaires à la devanture de son domicile. Pour disposer du stock en permanence, Houndjenko s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché d’Attikpodji. Houndjenko souhaite répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients et demande ce crédit pour acheter des légumes et disposer d’une rentabilité pour couvrir ses charges quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Houndjenko is 51 years old, married and mother to two children.  She lives in Attiégou and sells food products from the front of her house.  In order to maintain her stock levels, she buys her supplies twice a month from the market in Attikpodji.

Houndjenko would like to be able to adequately respond to the expectations of her customers, so she has requested this loan.  She will use it to buy vegetables which will generate enough profit to cover her day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy one basket of vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Gulbaniz

texts.en:
Gulbaniz is a 43-year-old farmer. She is married and her family is very big. She has five daughters and a son. Gulbaniz's husband, the head of the family, is a taxi driver. He earns for the family in order to help them to meet their life needs. Gulbaniz has been a farmer for 17 years and she is very experienced. 

Gulbaniz raises crops, fruits and vegetables and then supplies them to local bazaars and markets. She earns 200 AZN monthly. Her husband and children also help and support her. Her daughters prepare jam and fresh juice from fruits and sell them, too. This brings the family additional earnings. 

Gulbaniz takes care of her land and harvest properly. She built a greenhouse with her own money a long time ago in order to have a warm place during the winter. Gulbaniz applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to buy new equipment and tools for agriculture.

loans.use: to buy new equipment and tools for agriculture.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married. She has her own business.

Svetlana sells spices from Uzbekistan at the central market. The flavourings are sold by weight. Svetlana has one hired employee. Svetlana also sells wreaths made of artificial flowers during the memorial holidays. Her husband and daughter also help in her business. Svetlana had some really hard times in her life: her husband was seriously ill. Due to medical treatment, he got better and now his life in not in danger. 

Svetlana wants to develop her business further and buy a couple of kiosks. Svetlana is asking for a loan of 15 000 UAH to buy artificial flowers for wreaths.

loans.use: to buy artificial flowers to make wreaths for sale

loans.name: Mehi

texts.en:
Mehi is a 33-year-old gardener. He is married and has a son. His wife is a housekeeper and takes care of their child. Mehi is a hardworking man and loves his family very much. He raises and sells seasonal vegetables and greens. Fresh vegetables and greens are in high demand. People use them for fresh salads and different dishes. They also dry greens and use them for national dishes, too. 

Mehi has worked as a gardener for 10 years and he earns 150 AZN monthly. His garden is small and productivity isn't high, but Mehi does his best in order to earn money and meet his family's needs. He applied for a 1,200 AZN loan in order to repair a water tank in the house and to fix the irrigation system of the garden. This will resolve the problem of low productivity of his harvest.

loans.use: to repair a water tank in the house and to fix the irrigation system of the garden

loans.name: Berta Rubidia

texts.es:
Berta, opta por un nuevo crédito para comprar camarones, pescado y conchas, abastecerá su negocio con productos frescos para aprovechar la temporada de mejores ventas y seguir generando los ingresos que utiliza para subsistir junto a su familia y pagar su deuda.
El crédito anterior le ha beneficio mucho en su vida familiar y en su negocio, actualmente tiene nuevos clientes, mayor demanda de sus productos y puede cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia.
texts.en:
Berta is requesting a new loan to buy shrimp, fish and shellfish to stock her business with fresh products to take advantage of the high sales season.  This is to continue generating an income to support her family and pay off debt.

The previous loan was very beneficial to her family life and business.  Now she has new customers and a greater demand for her products so she is able to cover her family's basic needs.

loans.use: To buy shrimp, fish and shellfish to stock her business with fresh products and take advantage of the high demand.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
María, esta agradecida con Padecomsm y con los inversionistas Kiva por al apoyo que le brindan cuando lo necesita, nuevamente requiere de un crédito para comprar nacazcol, arcilla, barro crudo y leña, al contar con la materia prima para trabajar, su negocio seguirá funcionando y cubrirá las demandas de sus clientes.
Para María el préstamo anterior le ayudo a mantener la continuidad de su negocio y a contar con materiales para elaborar piezas de barro de mayor calidad, además mejoro el área de trabajo para realizar sus actividades en ambiente más cómodo. Su familia tiene acceso a mejor alimentación, vestuario y salud.
texts.en:
Maria is grateful to Padecomsm and Kiva lenders for their support when she needs it.  She is in need of a new loan to buy nacazcol (dye), clay, raw mud and firewood to have materials on hand to work.  This way, her business will continue and she can fill customer orders.

The previous loan helped Maria continue her business and have the materials to make better quality clay pieces.  She was also able to improve her work area to make her environment more comfortable.  Her family has access to better food, clothing and health.

loans.use: To buy dye, clay, raw mud and firewood to have materials on hand for her work.

loans.name: Motaz

texts.en:
Motaz is a 26-year-old married man from Rafah city. He has a farm where he plants seasonal fruits and vegetables. It is a good business but the income is not stable. Motaz would like to improve himself and to find an additional job, so he is now a student in a local university where he studies social science. 

Motaz took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. This will help him to read more articles and do his homework.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
Noemí, elabora pupusas para vender y tener ingresos para subsistir, está actividad la aprendió a desarrollarla dentro de su familia, con la experiencia necesaria se decidió por abrir su propio negocio, lo atiende de un horario de 4:00 p.m. a 10:00 p.m., la fortaleza de su negocio es que en la zona no tiene competencia. Ella vive con su familia integrada por su esposo y un nieto, juntos comparten el día a día.
Requiere de capital para comprar mesas, sillas, una plancha nueva, harina, aceite, quesillo, etc., con el equipo de trabajo y los ingredientes para elaborar la venta de pupusas mejorara su negocio y tendrá oportunidad de abrir otro punto de ventas en una colonia cercana, esto es con el fin de ampliar su negocio y mejorar su situación económica.
Sus sueños son comprar una casa nueva, pagar sus deudas y formar un patrimonio para su familia.
texts.en:
Noemi makes and sells pupusas (filled tortillas) to earn a living.  She learned the business from her family and with the necessary experience decided to open her own business.  She works from 4:00 p.m. to 10:00 p.m.  The advantage she has is that her business is located in an area without any competition.  She lives with her family, which consists of her husband and grandson.

Noemi is in need of a loan to buy tables, chairs, a new grill, flour, oil, cheese, etc.  With the equipment and ingredients to make pupusas she can improve her business and be in a position to open another sales point in a neighboring community.  This is so she can expand her business and improve her economy.

Her dream is to buy a new house, pay off debt and build assets for her family.

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs, a new grill, flour, oil, cheese, etc. to make pupusas and improve her business.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto, con el crédito anterior a mantenido su negocio de destazo de reses y cerdos en el mercado, tiene estabilidad económica y no presenta ningún problema en su negocio ni de salud.
Por la experiencia que ya tiene en el uso de créditos cree que son necesarios para ir mejorando constantemente y se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para comprar ganado para el destazo, para mantener el negocio funcionando.
texts.en:
Rigoberto used his previous loan for the beef and pork butcher shop he has in the market.  He has a stable economy and no business or health problems.

With the experience he has acquired through the loans he believes it is necessary to improve constantly.  Therefore he has decided to request a new loan to buy cattle to keep his business running.

loans.use: To buy cattle to keep his business running.

loans.name: Santos Gabino

texts.es:
Santos, ha notado que su negocio está atrayendo nuevos clientes y que su inventario necesita de nuevos productos para satisfacer sus demandas, es por tal razón que se ha decidido a solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar golosinas, especias, bebidas, pan, huevos, etc., para surtir la tienda y concentrado para alimentar el ganado en esta época seca.
El préstamo anterior le ha permitido tener un negocio que le genera los ingresos que necesita para ir mejorando su estilo de vida familiar e ir cancelando sus deudas.
texts.en: Santos has noticed that the store is attracting new customers and that he needs new products to satisfy their demands.  For that reason he's requesting a new loan to buy candy, spices, drinks, bread, and eggs among other things to stock his store and buy feed for his cattle during the dry season.  The previous loan has allowed him to generate the income that he needs to keep improving his family's lifestyle and pay his debts.

loans.use: to buy candy, spices, drinks, bread, and eggs among other things to stock his store and buy feed for his cattle during the dry season.

loans.name: Isaias Josue

texts.es: Isaías, tiene 23 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene un hijo, y reside en el municipio del Progreso, Yoro. Isaías tiene su propio negocio de barbería, ofrece los servicios de corte de pelo, masajes, mascarías y otros. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace dos años en un local donde alquila. Anteriormente vendía mercadería. El ha solicitado otro prestamo a la institución siendo el quinto ciclo y es por 15,000 Lempiras para compra de productos como es gelatina, loción de afeitar, cremas, productos para mascarías y masajes para uso en la barbería y venta. Considera que con esta inversión va obtener mas ganancias. Su sueño es darle buen estudio a su hijo y poner venta de lubricantes para motocicletas.
texts.en:
Isaías is 23 years old.  He lives with his spouse and child in the town of Progreso, Yoro.  Isaias has his own barber shop and provides hair cuts, massages, facials, among others.  He's been renting the shop for 2 years.  Previously, he sold other convenience store products.  
He has requested another loan, this is his fiftth cycle, this time for 15,000 Lempiras to buy gels, shaving lotions, creams, facial and massage products for his barber shop and for sale.  With this investment he'll be able to increase his income.  His dream is for his son to attend school and to sell his motorcycle lubricants.

loans.use: to buy gels, shaving lotions, creams, facial and massage products for his barber shop and for sale.

loans.name: Sombrero De Sao Group

texts.es:
Silvia es una mujer de 28 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos de 12, 10, 8 y 4 años, y su negocio es el tejido a mano de sombreros de Sao.
Ella es buena madre, comprensiva, emprendedora, independiente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la comunidad ‘Tundy’ ubicado a 25 kilómetros al sur este de la ciudad, con más de 250 años de fundación, se dedican principalmente a labores agropecuarias en estancias cercanas a su comunidad, los jóvenes y niños pasan rápidamente a un espacio laboral para poder apoyar a sus familias, dejando truncados en muchas ocasiones sus estudios. Normalmente los trabajos que desempeñan están relacionados a labores en los chacos, cuidado de ganado y en algunos casos niñeras o ayudante de albañiles en la ciudad. Estas condiciones están enmarcadas como trabajos riesgosos y llevan a los niños, niñas y adolescentes a posibles situaciones de explotación laboral.
Silvia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos obscuros, estatura mediana, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (la segunda de la derecha viste blusa amarilla y bermuda rosada, lleva un cuaderno en la mano). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica a la construcción y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela y colaboran en el negocio, viven en una casa construida de palos de madera con techo de calamina que cuenta con electricidad para conseguir agua los niños deben ir al rio a recogerla. La necesidad por mejorar sus ingresos para alimentar a su familia la llevo a formar una banca de personas con negocio como; comercio de gallinas, lavandería, venta de jugos, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, agricultura, venta de leche y comercio de madera, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar su situación económica. Su negocio es el tejido a mano de sombreros de sao; este tejido se elabora con las hojas de la palmera ‘Sao’ y es una tradición artesana heredada de sus padres, Las artesanas suelen recibir grandes pedidos especialmente para las fiestas de los pueblos de la región, y también para septiembre, que es el mes que recuerda la efeméride de la ciudad, es en esta época cuando elaboran faldas, vestidos y tops de saó, Y es durante el festival de la palma que en la misma localidad puede verse a las bellas candidatas a Reina de la Palmera, luciendo atuendos hechos de este material. “A veces nos juntamos con la vecina, nos ponemos a tejer, mirando la novela… Porque ahora ya tejemos sin mirar nuestras manos, miramos la novela y los dedos trabajan solitos, somos expertas…” comenta. Su sueño es alimentar a su familia de manera satisfactoria, ella desea realizar la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sombreros de sao. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de manera continua.
Es por esos motivos que Silvia solicita un préstamo para la compra de materia prima para la confección de sombreros de Sao y con los beneficios alimentar a su familia.
texts.en:
Silvia, 28, is married and has four children, ages 12, 10, 8 and 4.  Her business is making straw hats by hand.  She is a good, understanding, enterprising, independent, responsible and hard-working mother.  She works in the community of "Tundy" which is located 25 kilometers south of the city.  It was founded over 250 years ago and the locals work mainly in livestock farming near the community.  The youth and children start to work early to help their families, often cutting off their education.  Usually the work they do is related to swamp work, care of the cattle and in some cases as babysitters or bricklayer assistants working in the city.  These conditions are considered to be risky jobs and involve the children in possible situations of labor exploitation.

Silvia has a dark complexion, long black hair that she pulls back, dark eyes, medium height and a robust physical complexion.  Her mother tongue is Guarani which is spoken locally and she speaks Spanish for general cultural purposes and for her business.  (She is second from the right wearing a pale yellow top and pink bermudas, and holding a notebook.)  She shares her life with her husband who works in construction and their children attend school and help out in the business.  They live in a wooden house with a zinc roof and have electricity, but must go to the river for water.  The need to earn more income to feed her family is what motivated her to form a communal bank with people in businesses such as: chicken sales, laundry service, juice sales, food sales, a convenience store, farming, milk sales and wood trade, to request a loan and improve her economy.

She makes straw hats by hand out of  "Sao" (palm leaves).  It is a skill passed down from her parents.  The craft workers receive large orders, especially for village festivals in the the area and also in September when the Palm Queen contest is held.  "Sometimes we get together with a neighbor and weave while reading a novel...because now we can do it without looking at our hands.  We read the book and our fingers work by themselves.  We're experts..." she says.  Her dream is to feed her family adequately.  She wants to buy raw materials to make the straw hats.  This is her first loan through the institution in the seven years she has been in the business.

Therefore, Silvia is requesting a loan to buy raw materials to make straw hats and use the profits to feed her family.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make straw hats and use the profits to feed her family.

loans.name: Jose Balbino

texts.es:
José, es un agricultor, vive con su familia y su esposa, aún no tiene hijos, su única fuente de ingresos es cultivar granos básicos para que su familia tenga una buena alimentación y otra parte de la cosecha es comercializada para generar ingresos y cubrir otras necesidades familiares, el oficio lo heredo de su familia, está trabajando por su propia cuenta desde hace 6 años, su horario es de seis de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde.
Invertirá en abono, herbicidas e insecticidas, para preparar el terreno en el que sembrara granos básicos, será de ayuda para que su cosecha sea abundante y no tenga problemas de plagas, su propósito es tener mejor productividad y así mejorar su situación financiera. 
Sus aspiraciones son diversificar su negocio con la apertura de una ganadería y brindar oportunidades de mejor desarrollo a su familia en la sociedad.
texts.en:
José works in agriculture and lives with his family and his spouse.  They don'y have any kids yet.  He's only income is from planting basic grains so he can feed his family and the rest is sold to generate income and cover other family needs.  He inherited his job from his family and he's been working on his own for 6 years from 600AM to 400PM.  
He will use the loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and herbicide to prepare his plot to plant basic grains.  It will help so that the harvest is abundant and he has no plague problems.  His goal is to be more productive and improve his financial situation.  His long term goals are to diversify his business by opening a cattle enterprise and give better opportunities to his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and herbicide to prepare his plot to plant basic grains.

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
Melany es una joven mujer de 20 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 2 y 1 año, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, comprometida con su trabajo, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en el barrio ‘Internacional’ caracterizado por el crecimiento constante de su población; originarios de tribus nómadas del lugar como ‘Los Ayoreos’ y mineros relocalizados del occidente del país que hicieron de este sitio su hogar y que en su segunda generación abarrotaron las calles de un comercio y manufactura constante en todas las áreas, de clima cálido tropical, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-38 grados centígrados.
Melany es de tez trigueña, cabello castaño largo lo usa estilo cola de caballo, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (la segunda de la derecha, viste polera blanca, short azul y zapatillas rosadas), su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja en construcción y con sus hijos que son bebés, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su necesidad por darles a sus bebes un futuro mejor la llevo a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de repuestos de automóvil, Venta de embutidos, confección de cortinas, venta de gaseosas, tienda de barrio, librería, venta de comida, venta de ropa de bebé y vidriería, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano; ella se encarga de comprar ropa por fardos proveniente de los estados unidos y la separa por género y edad, organizándola para que sus cliente encuentren lo que buscan rápidamente, su negocio lo realiza en un puesto de venta fijo en la calle y al aire libre, para la exposición de la ropa arma un puesto de venta a manera de cuarto, exponiendo la ropa colgada en colgadores al interior del cuarto y otras sobre la mesa, actividad que realiza acompañada de sus bebés todos los días de la semana durante el día. “inicie mi negocio por la necesidad de trabajar y cuidar a mis hijos, este negocio me da la libertad de hacer las 2 cosas al mismo tiempo, soy independiente y tengo clientes constantes…” comenta. Su sueño es darles a sus hijos un futuro con comodidades, ella desea realizar la compra de ropa por fardos para aumentar su oferta generando mejores ingresos para el bien de su familia. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de forma continua.
Es por esos motivos que Melany solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa por fardos para aumentar sus ventas y darle bienestar a sus bebes.
texts.en:
Melany is a 20-year-old young woman who makes a living selling second hand clothes. She lives with her partner, and she has two children, who are one and two years of age. She is enterprising, friendly, responsible, very hard-working and committed to her work, as well as being a good mother.

Her business is situated in the 'Internacional' area of the city, which is an area characterised by the constant growth of its population, and by people from the nomadic tribes of the area, such as 'Los Ayoreos', and relocated miners from the west of the country, who have made this area their home. The second generations of these communities pack the streets with their shops, businesses and constant activity. The climate is warm and tropical, and the temperature varies during the day between 18 and 38 degrees centigrade.

Melany is small, slim and dark-skinned, with dark eyes and long, chestnut-coloured hair which she wears in a ponytail. Her mother-tongue is Guaraní, which is spoken in this area, and she speaks Spanish for her business and general culture. In the picture, she is the second on the right, wearing a white top, blue shorts and pink trainers. She shares her life with her partner, who works in construction, and her children, who are very young. They live in a rented room made of bricks, with a corrugated iron roof. They have drinking water, electricity and plumbing. 

Her need to give her children a better future inspired her to lead a Communal Bank formed of people with businesses selling products as varied as replacement automotive parts, cold meats, soft drinks, food, baby clothes and glassware, as well as people engaged in curtain-making, running a general store and a bookshop. They all came together with the aim of asking for a loan to improve their businesses. 

Melany's business is selling second-hand clothes. She buys second-hand clothes in bulk from the United States and sorts them according to gender and size. She organises them so that her customers can quickly find what they want. She sells the clothes from a permanent street stall, in the open air. She has arranged her stall like a room, with some clothes displayed on hangers in the interior of the room, and others on a table. She works every day of the week accompanied by her babies.

"I started my business because I needed to work and look after my children at the same time. This business gives me the freedom to do both. I'm independent, and I have regular customers," she says. Her dream is to give her children a comfortable life. She wants to buy more clothes in bulk so that she can expand her stock and increase her income for the well-being of her family. During the three years she has been running her business, this is the first loan cycle she has engaged in with the institution.

For all these reasons, Melany is asking for a loan in order to buy clothes in bulk, so that she can increase her sales and provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk, so that she can increase her sales and provide for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a bedroom for her young son, so that he might have his own space and privacy.

loans.name: Reinaldo

texts.es: Don Reinaldo, tiene 57 años de edad, es casado, tiene 4 hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira junto a su esposa, dos de sus hijos y un nieto. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura  de maíz, frijoles y café. El café es su mayor producción y la mejor fuente de ingresos, el cual vende en el mercado local ya despulpado y secado. Lleva siete prestamos en la institución con el actual que es por 15,000 lempiras, para compra de abonos, foliares, para fertilizar y fumigar su finca de café. Su motivación es seguir con el cultivo de café para obtener siempre sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Don Reinaldo is 57 years old and married with four children. He lives in a small village in the municipality of Gracias, in Lempira, Honduras, together with his wife, two of his sons and a grandson. 

All his life he has made a living farming maize, beans and coffee. Coffee is his biggest product and his largest source of income, and he sells the dried coffee beans in the local market. Including this loan of 15,000 HNL, he has had seven loans with the ODEF institution. He has used these loans to buy fertilisers and foliar fertilisers in order to fumigate and fertilise his coffee fields. He plans to continue cultivating coffee so that he will always have an income.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers and foliar fertilisers, in order to fertilise and fumigate his coffee fields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy school supplies, shoes and school uniforms.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay graduation fees and have another qualification to help her in her professional life, to develop her knowledge, and to improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a drain and install a toilet to replace the latrine she has.

loans.name: Perlas Preciosas San Pedro Group

texts.en:
San Pedro La Laguna is a small town on the shores of the beautiful Lake Atitlan in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. The volcano San Pedro towers above the town. It is here that eight very enthusiastic women have come together to form The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank, Perlas Preciosas San Pedro (Precious Pearls of San Pedro). Their purpose is to support one another and improve their lives. The women have agreed they will use a Kiva loan very productively.

Dolores is a member of the Trust Bank. She is 21 years old, married and has twin girls who bring her much joy, which motivates her work. Dolores makes regional blouses. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, and other accessories that make the production of her blouses possible. With the income that she generates from the sales of her blouses, she is able to fulfill her goal of a university education, as well as being able to feed her daughters. Right now, she is beginning to study social work. The other members of the group are also making good investment decisions with their micro credit loans. The loans are helping with their crafts.

The members of Perlas Preciosas San Pedro are extremely grateful to the Kiva investors for believing in them and investing in the dreams of the Guatemalan women. Thank you!

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, and other accessories that make the production of her blouses possible.

loans.name: Atef

texts.en:
Atef is a 20-year-old single man from Jabalia city. His mother works as an employee since his father is dead. She gets a very low income that is not enough to cover the family needs. 

Atef is a student in a local university where he studies tourism management. Atef took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. This will help him to read more articles and do his home work.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Marisol San Juan Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Marisol San Juan is a group of eight hardworking women with strong dreams. They work day to day in the small quiet town of San Juan La Laguna on the shores of the beautiful Lake Atitlan in Guatemala.  

One of the members of the group is Juana who is 47 years old and has three children. She has only six years of formal education. Her business is making typical bedspreads, tablecloths, curtains, shawls, and scarfs -- all are made in the local crafts manner. 

Juana is asking for a loan in order to purchase a large quantity of thread in different colors, designs and quality. She also wants to purchase accessories.  Juana has a great vision for her future and wants to have the ability to export her products to new markets with fair prices that can help her business stay afloat and make better profits. Her dream is that one day she does not need additional financial help. 

Juana uses her earnings to support two of her children with their university studies. Their studies motivate her to continue to want to learn and be educated. Additional education is possible for her through The Friendship Bridge non-formal education program, Microcredit Plus, which provides in its monthly Trust Bank meetings a variety of topics. One topic that was important to Juana was business management skills. The fusion of credit and education -- Microcredit Plus -- helps Juana and the other members of the group with the process of empowerment, which then helps them get out of poverty by themselves. Many thanks to the Kiva investors for making the women’s world a better place to live!

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of thread in different colors, designs and quality.

loans.name: Adham

texts.en:
Adham is a 25-yeas-old single man from Jenin city.  He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a very low income that is not enough to cover his needs. 

Adham is also a student in a local university where he studies social science. He wants to take a BA degree and find a better job.

Adham took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. This will help him to read more articles and do his home work.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en:
Tarana is a 49-year-old married woman. Her husband is a labourer and they have two sons. The members of the family are refugees and live in the Bilesuvar IDP settlement. 

Tarana is gardener. She raises and sells seasonal fruits because they are in high demand. She works in gardening for 12 years and her monthly income is 187 AZN. Her children support her and help her to raise trees and take care of garden. 

Now Tarana has applied for an 1,500 AZN loan in order to buy new garden tools and supply fertilizers for spring season. She wants her garden to grow properly and increase the productivity of her harvest. This will allow her to sell more products in the local bazaar and earn more money.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools and fertilizers for spring season.

loans.name: Reham

texts.en:
Reham is a 23-year-old single lady from Gaza city. Her father works as a taxi driver where he gets a very low income, which is not enough to cover all the family needs. 

Reham is a student in a local university where she studies Information systems. She wants to take the BA degree and find a job to improve her family's living conditions.

Reham took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her study. This will help her to read more articles and do her home work.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her study.

loans.name: Grupo Los Siete Picos Group

texts.es:
Catarina es una mujer de 30 años de edad, esta simplemente juntada con su esposo, tiene 2 hijos de las edades entre 3 y 9 años de edad, vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Catarina (la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía, la de blusa café) es una madre de familia dedica al trabajo y su única razón de vivir son sus hijos, para que no le falte nada Catarina apoya a su esposo con los ingresos  de la casa, ella se dedica a la elaboración de  ropa típica de su región, esta actividad lo aprendió gracias a su madre quien se dedica a la misma actividad, Catarina cuenta con 15 años de experiencia , es por eso que su producto cuenta con mucha demanda, pero en estos últimos años los tejidos típicos han sufrido cambios, en su estilo y diseño, es por eso que ella quiere modernizar sus tejidos por tal motivo se a juntado a un grupo de señoras con la misma actividad, para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar, hilos de tipo alemán, seda, lustrina manchada.
El sueño más grande de Catarina es poder realizar esta inversión para mejorar sus ingresos y que puedan construir su casa
texts.en: Catarina is a 30 year old woman. She has a domestic partner and two children who are 3 and 9 years old. She lives in the community of Sololá. Catarina (the first one on the left, in a brown blouse) is a mother who works hard so that her children, the reason of her life, will have everything. Catarina helps her partner with household income. She works making native clothing from her region. She learned this job thanks to her mother who also works in it. Catarina has 15 years of experience. This is why her product is in high demand; however, in these last years the typical garments have changed in style and design. This is why she wants to renew her garments. For this reason, she has got together with a group of women doing the same job in order to request a loan that will be used to buy German style threads, silk and stained silk cloth. Catarina's biggest dream is to be able to make this investment in order to improve her income and be able to build a house.

loans.use: to buy German type threads, silk and silk cloth to make native dresses.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 21-year-old single man from Gaza city. His father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a very low income that is not enough to cover all the family needs. 

Ahmad is a student in a local university where he studies nursing. He wants to take a BA degree and find a job to improve his family's living conditions.

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. This will help him to finish his study faster.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Shaker

texts.en:
Shaker is a 27-year-old single man from a village near Jenin city. He works as a teacher in the public sector where he gets a very low income that is not enough to cover all the family needs. 

Shaker is also a masters student in a local university where he studies Arabic literature. He wants to take a master's degree to improve himself.

Shaker took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. This will help him to finish his study faster.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.en:
Yasmin is a 22-year-old married lady from Bethlehem city. Her husband works as an employee in a local firm. He earns a very low income, which is not enough to cover all of the family's needs. Yasmin is a student in a local university where she studies math. She wants to complete the BA degree to find a job in the future to help her husband with part of the family's expenses.

Yasmin requested a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester. This will help her to finish her studies faster.

Yasmin appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy products and supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business further if you will let her borrow again an amount of 40,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional grocery items, toiletries, and beverages. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Nancy wants to expand her business so that she can continue to support the educational needs of her children. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy raw materials and supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business further if you will let her borrow again an amount of 30,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional materials needed in making a flower decorations such as plastic flowers, newspaper, varnish, white glue and other supplies. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Rosalie wants to improve their present financial status and give her family a better future. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the materials needed to make flower decorations, such as plastic flowers, newspaper, varnish, white glue, and other materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a 10 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Claveles Santa Rita Group

texts.en:
Twelve women make up The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank Claveles Santa Rita. The Trust Bank is located in the small town of Nahala, which is in the highlands of Western Guatemala. All of them speak the Maya-K’iche language with only half speaking and understanding Spanish. The average age of the group is 36 years, with about four years each of formal education. They have an average of three children.  

The various activities of the group are weaving, buying and selling typical local items, selling fruit, and selling shoes. One has a shop that sells food. Manuela, 48, along with her family, has a furniture shop where she makes carvings, closets, cabinets and other furniture made of wood. The family business has had success. She wants to make more investments in the business, and thus is asking for a new loan that she can invest in buying raw material, wood and tools that she can use in make furniture, as well as accessories to enhance the furniture. Her objective is to strengthen her business and leave it to her children, since that is the only way she can provide them with a primary education. The youngest of the nine children is the only one who continues studying and that motivates her. 

The Claveles Santa Rita hope to receive loans in order to continue fighting for their dreams. They send very cordial greetings and gratitude to the Kiva investors for financing their loans.

loans.use: to buy raw material, wood and tools that she can use to make furniture, as well as accessories to enhance the furniture.

loans.name: Makongo Kk Group

texts.en:
Paulo, who is in his late 30s, is married with three children who are still in school.  He has been selling charcoal for eight years now.  He works from 7 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Paulo's 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase his charcoal stock, and he has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees, bought a plot of land, built his house and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal to resell. He dreams of going to the forest to collect the charcoal himself. 

Paulo will share this loan with his loan group "Makongo K.K.", which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charchoal to resell.

loans.name: Odeh

texts.en:
