Odeh is a 20-year-old single man from Gaza city. His father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a very low income which is not enough to cover all of the family's needs. Odeh is a student in a local university where he studies accounting. He wants to complete the BA degree to find a better job in the future.

Odeh took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. This will help him to finish his studies faster.

Odeh appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Wasim

texts.en:
Wasim is a 22-year-old single man from Nablus city. His father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a very low income which is not enough to cover all of the family's needs. Wasim is a student in a local university where he studied business administration. He wants to complete the BA degree to find a job in the future.

Wasim took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. This will help him to finish his studies faster.

Wasim appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Ushirika Grp Group

texts.en:
TABU, who is in his early 40s is married with 9 children who are still in school. He has been selling agriculture equipments for six years now.  He works from 7 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.  

This will be TABU's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He will use this loan to increase his agriculture equipment for his shop and meet his customers' requirements. He dreams of extending the size of his shop.

Tabu will share this loan with his loan group "USHIRIKA GRP", which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase his agriculture equipment for his shop and meet his customers' requirement.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia sends you her thanks for your generosity because of her previous loan. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for the educational expense of her child and pay for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she can improve her business more if you will lend her an amount of 25,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stocks of groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit which will result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she can sustain the needs of her family.

Virginia hopes to have a bigger store so she can stock more items and expand her product inventory. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
This is Divina, 47, resident of Manila City, Philippines. She is married to William and they manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Divina operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to use cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. 

Divina hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a good life. She plans to save more for her old age. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy the raw ingredients she needs to make more viands and other food choices to sell.

loans.name: Tadevos

texts.en: Tadevos lives in Tsovagyugh in the Gegharkunik region. His wife works at the rest house in Sevan city. They have two children, who are both students. His first loan with Kiva helped Tadevos to pay for his daughter’s tuition fee for which he is thankful. Now he works at the post office where he is a department manager and at the same time is engaged in farming. In his farm, he has cows, calves, pigs, bulls and sheep. Thanks to his hard work and skills in farming, he sells his farm products such as milk, meat (pork, beef and mutton) and eggs. With this loan, Tadevos wants to buy several sheep and a lot of animal fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy several sheep and a lot of animal fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is 35 years old and he lives with his lovely mother in the village Geghamavan of the Gegharkunik region. Edgar has vocational education in banking work, but he did not manage to find a job and decided to develop the farm that his parents once established. Now with his mother, he takes care of cows, calves, bulls, heifers, pigs, sheep and chickens. He is also already skilled in land cultivation and he sells good potatoes at the city’s wholesale market. Edgar greatly hopes that among so many programs and offers from loan lending programs and organizations, his choice of having a partnership with Kiva and Nor Horizon is right and will be really profitable. 

He wants to spend this loan on the purchase of animal fodder for his farm cattle since his farm animals have great need of it. The season of milking is coming and his farm cows especially need enough fodder to give enough milk for sale.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his farm cattle since his farm animals have great need of it.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik lives with his wife in Kapan city, which is in Syunik region. They have three children (two daughters and a son) and all of them are married and live with their families.

Gaik’s wife used to have her small clothes trading business, but now she closed it and she is a housewife at this moment.  Gagik worked for many years as a locksmith at the Kapan city combine but he lost that job. Since 2011, Gagik has established his own business as a source of income for his family, retailing water heating systems and household goods. He brings his shop’s merchandise from Yerevan city on a rented truck once in a month. He tries to keep the assortment of his shop full and useful since he has a lot of customers not only from the city but also from the whole region.

Gagaik asks for this loan as he wants to buy some new products for his shop, and also to complement products that are already sold out but still have great demand.

loans.use: to buy some new products for his shop and also to complement products that are already sold out but still have great demand

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
This young lady is 24 years old and her name is Lusine. She lives with her mother in Vanadzor City in the Lori region. Her father is in the Russian Federation now. He works there and sends money for his family's needs. Lusine graduated Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute the faculty of Russian Language and Literature. For the past 2 years she has worked at the school as a teacher of Russian Language and Literature. At their flat she also organizes course for a small group of pupils whom she helps to overcome the hardships with grammar, writing skills and misunderstandings in speaking skills. 

Lusine asks for this loan as she has a great need of methodological literature of teaching because she is a beginner in this field and she would also like to purchase a computer which will be useful for her pedagogical development.

loans.use: to buy methodological literature and a computer

loans.name: Katonzi Nyakabingo Iii Group

texts.en: Joseph is fifty years old, a hard working married man with ten children of whom six go to school in Kasese Uganda. He is a member of Katonzi Nyakabingo III group. He is a farmer rearing pigs and poultry. He has managed to educate his children and earn a living through those projects. As a good father, he has a dream of educating his children. However, he is faced with the challenge of diseases, changes in market prices and long distance to reach the market. Joseph wants a loan to buy chicks for laying eggs to sell.

loans.use: to buy chicks for laying eggs to sell.

loans.name: Kanyampara Thuyimanaye Group

texts.en: Chrispo is a 50-year-old hard-working married man with ten children, eight of them go to school. He is a member of Kanyampara Thuyimanaye group living in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a butcher shop and has been in that business for seven years. He began the business in order to fight against poverty. He loves his children and wants them to have a bright future, which is why he dreams of educating his children. Chrispo is requesting a loan to buy goats for slaughtering to sell.

loans.use: to buy goats for slaughtering to sell.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en: Gohar is 44 years old and she lives with her single son (17 years old) in her native village Tsaghkunk of the Ggegharkunik region. Gohar says that once she dreamed of becoming tailor but since she had to bring up her son alone from her a very young age she forgot her dream and established a very cute farm in order to earn their living. Now in her farm she has a cow, a bull and chickens. Her land is big and on it each season she cultivates a lot of potato for sale, which is of great demand since potato of this region is the tastiest. It is obvious that the assortment of her farm products is very small. She sells  milk, eggs and potatoes in the city at the wholesale market. Gohar hopes that, as usual, the potato cultivation this season will bring good income. She wants this loan to buy potato seedlings for spring sowing activities.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings for spring sowing activities.

loans.name: Muhokya Twekambe Group

texts.en: Jane lives in Kasese, Uganda. She is 50 years old, a hard-working married woman with four children, two of whom go to school. She is a member of Muhokya Twekambe group. She has run a restaurant since 1993. She began the business to generate income for her family. She has a dream of expanding her business in order to realize more profits. Price changes and limited capital are her major challenges. Jane is requesting a loan to buy plates, customer seats, tables and forks/spoons to use in the restaurant.

loans.use: to buy plates, customer seats, tables and forks/spoons to use in the restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay for labor.

loans.name: Alik

texts.en:
Alik lives with his parents in Vanadzor city in Lori region. Alik is 27 years old. His father is unemployed now and his mother works as a tailoring worker.

Alik now works at the police station and, since he has shift work, he also manages to have his own small business that is in a rented garage.  He gives car repairing and painting services. He has run this business for 3 years already and year by year the number of his customers becomes more and more thanks to his small, quick and not expensive prices of services.

Alik has a dream and for making it true, he is ready to work without holidays and till late at night. In the devastating earthquake of 1988, Alik’s family lost its house. Within seconds their house turned into ruins. Now the only desire of his family is to have their own cute and warm house. Now they live in a very uncomfortable cabin which lacks basic amenities, and only by developing his business will Alik manage to have enough money to finally buy a house.

He asks for this loan as he wants to buy a compressor and also several electric tools for his car repairing and painting activities.

loans.use: to buy a compressor and also several electric tools for his car repairing and painting activities

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is 39 years old, and she says she does not imagine what she would do if not farming and agriculture. She has a big family, and she lives with her husband, and three children in the village Tsovagyugh of the Gegharkunik region. Their elder daughter is a student and her two sons are still school-aged. Karine and her husband are unemployed and for many years they covered their family's needs through farming. On her farm, Kaine has 3 cows, 2 calves and 10 chickens. The farm is cute but their plot of land is rather large and has a great assortment of harvest that both is sold and the family uses. Karine during the week sells these harvests (potatoes, greens, cabbages, onions, tomatoes, cucumbers, radishes, eggplants, zucchinis and peppers) at the wholesale market or locally to people from the village. 

This loan will be timely and it will greatly develop her agricultural activities. With this loan amount she wants to buy vegetable seedlings, diesel fuel and also fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seedlings, diesel fuel and also fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Seyran

texts.en:
Seyran is 57 years old and he lives in Vanadzor city in Lori region. Seyran is married and he has a son and a daughter. His daughter is married and she lives separately with her family.

For many years till today, Seyran has worked at different workshops as an electrician. His son is a constructor. Seyran is now unbelievably happy and wants to share his happiness with Kiva lenders and Nor Horizon: his son is going to get engaged and he has a very nice and charming bride.

He asks for this loan in an amount of 160,000 Armenian drams for his son’s engagement as he wants to buy a lot nice presents both for his son and his pretty bride.

loans.use: to buy a lot of nice presents both for his son and his pretty bride

loans.name: Margo

texts.en:
Margo is 51 years old, and she lives with her family in the frontier village Aygehovit of the Tavush region. Margo’s son is 31 years old, and he is works in construction. Like many young people in the village, he seasonally goes to the Russian Federation to work abroad to help to overcome his family’s financial needs, while Margo and her husband do their best to earn money through farming. On her farm, Margo has pigs and piglets and also a lot of chickens. Swine breeding and poultry are greatly developed on her farm. She sells a lot of pork to the city butchers and eggs to her neighbors. The nice orchard near the house is also under Margo’s care and from here she gathers harvest of apples, figs, pumas and nuts for sale. Margo and her husband work very hard because the farm is the only constant income that allows their family to cover their minimum needs, and also cover the cost of education of their daughter, who is a student at the State University of Ijevan. 

Margo needs financial support and hopes that through the Kiva lenders she will manage to buy several pigs of a new variety and also a lot of animal fodder for all of her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy several pigs of a new variety and also buy a lot of animal fodder for all of her farm cattle

loans.name: Vagharshak

texts.en:
Vagharshak runs his farming business in the village Tsovagyugh of the Gegharkunik region. Over 30 years little by little he established and enlarged his farm. Now it is a rich and profitable source of income for Vaghinak’s family. Here he takes care of cows, calves, heifers, a bull, sheep, a pig and chickens. This kind of assortment of cattle demands great care, which he manages with the help of his wife. Together they also manage the sale of their farm products, such as meat (pork, mutton and beef), milk, cheese, macun (national dairy-product) and eggs. They sell it at the city wholesale market or in the village to their neighbors. Vaghinak has a son, who also helps them with the farming business as he is unemployed now and has a lot of free time to spend at their farm. Land cultivation in its turn brings income to this family. Vaghinak cultivates potato, which he sells wholesale. 

This loan of 700.000 Armenian drams that Vaghinak has requested is for the purchase of a calf, animal fodder for all of his farm cattle, potato seedlings and diesel fuel since it is high time for starting spring sowing activities.

loans.use: to buy a calf, animal fodder for all of his farm cattle, potato seedlings and diesel fuel since it is high time for starting spring sowing

loans.name: Lena

texts.en:
Lena lives in the village Tsovagyugh of the Gegharkunik region and is married and has a big family. Lena has 6 children: 5 daughters and a son. Her daughters are married and her son is passing his military service in the army. Lena with her beloved husband happily and with great pleasure run a farming business since the age of 19, when she got married. Lena says that each animal of her farm is wealth for her and with great pride she lists how many and what kind of cattle she has now: 5 cows, 3 calves, 2 bulls, a heifer, 12 sheep, 2 lambs and 20 chickens. She sells a lot of milk and a great assortment of dairy products from her farm, and also meat and eggs. The land cultivation and income from is also part of her family income in which Lena’s husband has great skills and perfectly manages to cultivate on their plot of land vegetables and fruits (potato, beans, tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbage and fruits such as apples, figs, persimmons, plums, etc.).

This loan will be great for Lena as it will help to make her farm richer with one more calf, and she will also buy animal fodder for all of her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy one more calf and animal fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy secondhand skirts, blouses, t-shirts and others to sell

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando es un hombre de 35 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es la confección de chaquetas.
Él es independiente, emprendedor, paciente, optimista, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Villa bajo tejada’ un área caracterizada por la fabricación de tejas para el techo y por el comercio informal en todas las áreas; cientos de comerciante se acomodan lado a lado para ofertar ropa, comida, carnes, frutas, etc., de clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 5-15 grados centígrados y durante todo el año.
Fernando es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. su vida la comparte con sus familiares que fueron los que lo iniciaron en el negocio, viven en una casa familiar construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección de chaquetas, él se encarga de comprar tela por mayor para confeccionar todo tipo de chaquetas para todas las edades, labor que inicio por herencia de su familia que se dedica a la confección de ropa. “mi familia confeccióna pantalones deportivos, camisas y otras variedades de ropa, yo me especializa en chaquetas de hombre y de mujer en diferentes tamaños…” comenta. Su sueño es contar con una empresa de confección con varios empleados que elaboren ropa, él desea realizar la compra de tela por mayor de temporada, para confeccionar nuevas chaquetas con nuevos diseños y colores. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Fernando solicita un préstamo para la compra de cortes de tela de temporada por mayor para confeccionar chaquetas de moda.
texts.en:
Fernando, age 35, is single and has no children.  His business is making jackets.  He is independent, enterprising, patient, optimistic, responsible, and very hard-working.  He conducts his business in the Villa Bajo Tejada area.  The area is known for making roof tiles and for informal trade in all areas.  Hundreds of merchants are situated side by side selling clothes, food, meat, and fruit, etc.  Its climate is cold and dry, and the temperature varies during the day between 5 and 15 degrees centigrade all year.

Fernando has a dark complexion, short black hair, dark eyes, and is short and robust.  His mother tongue is Aymará, which he speaks with his family.  He speaks Spanish with the general public and for the business that he does.  He shares his life with his relatives who started in the business.  He lives in a family house made from brick and cement with a roof of metal sheeting.  He has running water, electricity, and indoor plumbing.

His business is making jackets.  He buys fabric wholesale in order to make all types of jackets for all ages.  He started the work as an inheritance from his family, which makes clothes.  “My family makes sport pants, shorts, and other varieties of clothes.  I specialize in men’s and women’s jackets in different sizes,” he says.

His dream is to have a sewing business with various employees making clothes.  He wishes to buy seasonal fabric wholesale in order to make new jackets with new designs and colors.  This is his first loan cycle with the institution in the five years that he has been engaged in this business activity independently.

It is for these reasons that Fernando is requesting a loan to buy seasonal fabric wholesale in order to make stylish jackets.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fabric wholesale in order to make stylish jackets.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
This nice lady is 31 years old and her name is Hasmik. Hasmik lives in the village of Tsovagyugh in the Gegharkunik region with her husband and pretty daughter (school-aged). Hasmik is a housewife and also a good farmer.

On her farm she takes care of 3 cows, 4 calves, 2 heifers, a bull, 9 sheep and a horse. She also perfectly cares for her land and on it she cultivates potato, greens and cucumbers. She sells her farm products locally, since she is alone in all these activities. Her husband works in construction; he works without holidays and until late at night. Sometimes only Hasmik’s daughter helps her, especially when at harvest time.

Hasmik is very worried since it is the start of the peak of spring sowing activities, but she has a lack of money to get prepared. With this loan amount she hopes she will buy a great quantity of potato seedlings and also some animal fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy a great quantity of potato seedlings and also some animal fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is 65 years old and she lives in the village of Achanan in the Syunik region. Nina is a widow. She has two sons and a daughter. All of them are married and live separately with their families.

Nina received a vocational education and after that she worked for many years at the meteorological center. Now she is unemployed and engaged in poultry and agricultural activities. She has a great interest in developing it more. On her plot of land she raises and sells potato, cucumber, tomatoes and greens. Poultry has also turned out to be profitable, as she manages to sell a lot of eggs and poultry.

Nina asks for a loan of 500.000 AMD in order to buy 150 brood hens, fodder for all her chickens and also potato seedlings.

loans.use: to buy 150 brood hens, fodder for all her chickens and also potato seedlings.

loans.name: Ramathan

texts.en:
Ramathan is a hardworking, Ugandan, married man, 31 years of age with 4 children. He sells cereal produce like maize, and groundnuts and beans. He earns extra income from farming.

He desires to build a commercial house but he is challenged by price fluctuations and inadequate capital to increase his stock. He needs a credit facility to buy maize, groundnuts and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize, groundnuts and beans to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 46-year-old Ugandan male living in Kamwenge. He is a hardworking, married man and a farmer who gets additional income from goat rearing. With this, he has been able to sustain his family. He hopes to expand his coffee plantation; however, his main challenge is poor seasonal conditions.

He is requesting a loan to buy more manure and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more manure and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a 30-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is a depot shop, alongside brick making and farming. He was inspired by the need to earn a living and educate his children. He faces a challenge of the high rate of defaulters; however, he hopes to expand his business, become a known businessman, and have educated children.

He is requesting a loan to buy more crates of sodas, beers and cartons of water to sell.

loans.use: to buy more crates of sodas, beers and cartons of water

loans.name: Fabian

texts.en:
Fabian has worked in the food-truck business for nearly 10 years. Prior to owning his own food truck, he worked for a well-known San Diego Mexican seafood vendor who taught Fabian everything he knows about cooking and running a business. 

In April 2014, Fabian purchased a food truck and vending location from a family friend. Within a month, he started serving food outside of a local Mexican market. A family owned and operated business, Fabian and his wife run the day-to-day operations of the food truck and are open every day of the week. 

Growing up in the coastal town of San Felipe, Mexico, Fabian discovered his love for seafood as a young boy. He worked for many years preparing and cooking seafood before relocating to San Diego with his family. 

Although Fabian had enough personal capital saved up to purchase the truck ready to operate, he was in need of additional capital to do maintenance and improvements. He is using his Kiva loan funds to tune up the motor and to redo the dining area near the truck. He plans to put in grass and a couple of sets of chairs and tables for his guests to enjoy their meals right next to the truck. 

Over the past several months since opening his business, Fabian’s biggest challenge has been attracting new clientele. He is confident, however, that the planned improvements to the dining area near the truck will invite new customers. His truck is also located along a busy street.

As a first-time business owner, Fabian is excited to be embarking on this adventure. With the help of generous Kiva lenders, Fabian is able to turn his passion for seafood into a business that will support his family.

loans.use: to pay for improvements on the food truck and outside dining area

loans.name: Basudeb

texts.en:
Basudeb is a 33-year-old, differently abled man who lives with his parents, wife and a 4-year-old child in a village of Cuttack District, Odisha. He is engaged in vegetable cultivation and selling. He has been doing this business for the last eight years. His father helps him in this business. He earns 5,000 INR per month from this business. Basudeb is a very hardworking and responsible man.

Basudeb has requested this loan to take land on lease so he can produce more vegetables and can make more money. He dreams to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to take land on lease so he can produce more vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase stock and to buy up-to-date clothes to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had enhanced her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for the educational expense of her children, and pay for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will lend her an amount of 15,000 PHP. This new loan will go to an additional stock of groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her customers will likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed on her store. An increase in sales will also result to a significant increase in profit, which will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Virginia wishes for her family to be always in good health, and dreams for her business to last longer. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius owns a depot of beverages and soft drinks. He is 33 years old and still strongly married, with three children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He also earns a salary, since he is a teacher by profession, which helps him meet the family's monetary demands. 

His vision is to have a model depot with branches all over the district in the near future, and to build a strong residential house. However, he has been faced with a challenge of stiff completion from richer traders, which affects the performance of his business. 

He is requesting a loan to buy iron sheets to roof his residential house.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets to roof his residential house.

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Josephat is a 36-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in cattle fattening as his main source of income, although he also practices the selling of milk. He has been able to sustain his family and educate his children from those businesses. High transport costs and inadequate capital are his main challenges, however, he hopes to have an improved business.

He is requesting a loan to buy more cows for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows for his farm.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 48-year-old hardworking man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a butchery as his main source of income, alongside farming. It is from these businesses that he has been able to meet his family needs. He faces challenges of the high costs of purchasing cows and a lack of capital, however he hopes to become an advanced farmer and have an expanded business. 

He is requesting a loan to buy cows for the Easter season.

loans.use: to buy cows for Easter season.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a 45-year-old hardworking married man with four children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has been able to look after his family and educate his children from his retail shop business, alongside farming. Poor transport means and inadequate capital are his main problems, however, he hopes to become a prominent businessman.

He is requesting a loan to buy more sugar, salt, soap and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, soap and other general merchandise

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline who is a 38-year-old hardworking married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda; she runs a boutique as her main source of income. She started this business to earn more income and look after her family. The high rate of taxation, competition and inadequate capital are her main problems, however, she has a vision of owning a wholesale boutique, having educated children and an empowered family.

She is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell during the Easter season.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell during the Easter season.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is a retail shop, along with farming. He started this business to increase his income inflow and look after his family.  He has hardships of a lack of capital and price fluctuations; however, he has a vision of owning a big known and advanced wholesale shop. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more salt, crates of sodas, soap and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy more salt, crates of sodas, soap and other items to sell.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus, who is a 45-year-old, hardworking, married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda, used his previous loan to buy seedlings and fertilizers for his farm. His main business is still farming, alongside a monthly salary. He started this business to increase his income inflow and educate his children. He has hardships of a lack of capital and prolonged drought; however, he has a vision of becoming a prominent businessman and constructing a permanent house.

He is requesting a loan to buy more manure and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more manure and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Neckson

texts.en:
Neckson is a 30-year-old, hardworking, married man with three children who lives in Kasese, Uganda. Neckson has been running a general store for 10 years now, where he has been facing hardships of market competition and limited capital, which hinders his business growth. He is looking forward to educating his children and constructing a residential house. 

Neckson is requesting a loan to buy sugar, salt, rice, cassava flour and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, rice, cassava flour and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a 36-year-old, hardworking woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She deals in the making of bridal cakes as her main source of income, although she also sells bedsheets as her side income. It is from these businesses that she has been able to sustain her family. High rent and license fees are a problem, but she has hopes of becoming a known businesswoman and building a residential house.

Joy is requesting a loan to buy raw materials for baking cakes.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for baking cakes.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a 26-year-old man with one child living in Fort Portal. He used the previous loan to buy maize for selling. He sells maize and beans, and in addition he grows bananas to sell that adds more income for him. He is faced with a challenge of little capital that hinders progress in his business. However, he has hopes of having enough stock of produce to serve his customers better and having a healthy family. 

Edward needs a loan to buy maize and beans for selling.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to hire laborers to harvest coffee.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard used his previous loan to buy manure and fertilizer for his farm. He is a 60-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He still deals in farming, where he grows bananas as his main source of income, although he also carries out cattle grazing to earn extra income. He started this business to look after his family. He still faces a challenge of seasonal markets for his products. He still has a vision of owning a modernized farm, and educating his children to higher levels of education. 

He is requesting a loan to buy manure and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a 41-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in coffee selling as his main source of income. He also earns extra income from his tents and chairs that he rents. He has a challenge of inadequate capital to fully fund his business. He has ambitions of raising money to build a personal permanent house and educating his children. 

He is requesting a loan to buy manure and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Grupo Sector Iglesia Arca De Noe Group

texts.es:
Juliana tiene 55 años de edad, esta simplemente en unión con su esposo con el que tiene 2 hijos, vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Juliana (la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía de blusa morado) Ella es una mujer que trabaja de sol a sol para que a su familia no le haga falta nada, es por eso que para generar sus ingresos desde hace 6 años se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, ella vende su producto como ambulante, en la plaza de su comunidad, y en  los alrededores de su comunidad,  gracias a esta labor ha mantenido a su familia por estos tiempos, pero ella quiere incrementar su negocio pero para hacerlo se necesita de un buen capital, pero una de las  dificultades que Juliana tiene es que no cuenta con suficiente dinero para realizar la inversión, entonces ella a organizado a un grupo de señoras con la misma actividad y con el mismo objetivo, para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizaran para comprar una diversidad de ropa típica de su región.
El deseo de Juliana es hacer que su pequeño negocio crezca, para que pueda mejorar sus ingresos, que ella cuente con un puesto en la plaza de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Juliana is 55 years old. She lives simply with her husband with whom she has 2 children. They live in a community of Sololá. Juliana is first from the left side in the photograph, wearing a purple blouse. She is a woman who works from dawn to dusk so her family doesn't need anything. For this reason, in order to generate income for the last 6 years she has been buying and selling traditional clothing. She sells her products by foot, in the plaza of the community and the surrounding neighborhood. 

Thanks to this work she has supported her family during this time, but she wants to expand her business. To do so she needs capital, but one of the difficulties of Juliana has been that she does not have sufficient money to make the investment. She then organized with a group of women with the same activity and same goals to ask for a loan together and utilize the money to buy a variety of traditional clothing of the region.

Juliana's desire is to make her small business grow, so she can improve her income, and sell with a stall in the plaza of her community.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Sabitri

texts.en:
Sabitri is 47 years old and a differently abled woman who lives with her husband and two children in a small village of Balasore district, Odisha. She has two sons, and both are working in a private company. She owns a general store where she sells ladies' fashion items, cosmetics for ladies and dressmaking supplies. She also does tailoring and gives training to others. She wants to start a ladies cloth store where she will sell cloth only for females.

Sabitri has requested a loan of 70,000 INR to buy female cloth in bulk to resell. She hopes to do well in her business, and she would like to thank Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: to buy cloth for ladies

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has always been passionate about art. Drawing and painting as a kid, he pursued art more formally through a degree in graphic design, and later as a lab technician at a local college, in the ceramics department.  

Over the past couple years, he has started selling pieces randomly at swap meets, and has also generated some graphic work for a couple of clients. He is now looking to take his business a step further by increasing his production, placing art in galleries, public spaces, and festivals, as well as by creating an e-commerce website that will allow for clients to order online. He has contacted several curators who are willing to work with him on placing art. 
 
Joseph will use the Kiva loan to produce more artwork in-house, such as business marketing materials. This includes a large format printer, remote flash, and hood for his camera. He also plans to attend several swap meets, festivals, and the local art walks.

Joseph really is a jack-of-all-trades when it comes to art. He is excited to share his passion for art with people and help them achieve their dreams through art.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment to increase his ability to print

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy zinc sheeting and purlins to roof a room that he built with the last loan.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy products and supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her borrow again an amount of 20,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional groceries, toiletries and beverages. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Editha wants her business to grow more and she desires to have more businesses and investments. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries and beverages to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anzhela

texts.en: This charming lady is 42 years old, and her name is Anzhela. She lives with her husband and children in the city of Kapan in the Syunik region. Anzhela graduated from medical college in Moscow, with a specialty in ophthalmology, and she practiced there for several years. Since 2013, Anzhela has been running her own business at a rented shop; she provides medical services as an optician. She says that she has a lot of loyal customers, and her professional qualifications allow her to have more and more patients. Anzhel’s husband is a busy farmer in the nearby village of Geghi. Anzhela will be grateful to have this loan from Kiva, which she wants to use to buy new products for her optician shop, as well as a special machine to be used in checking patients’ eyesight.

loans.use: to buy new products and a special machine used to check patients' eyesight for her optician's shop.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en: Narine is very happy with her profession as a teacher, to which she has devoted 20 years. She takes pleasure in her work. She works at a school as a teacher of secondary classes. She mentions that she does her work with children very responsibly and with great care, in such a way that children themselves become actively interested in their lessons. Narine lives in the city of Vanadzor in the Syunik region. She is married and has a daughter. Narine will be happy to receive this loan, as she wants to buy a computer and professional publications, so that she remain aware of innovations in teaching methodology.  What she can’t manage to find in the books, she will search for on websites with the help of the computer.

loans.use: to buy a computer and professional literature, as she wants to remain aware of any innovations in teaching methodology.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en: Vladimir from Yerevan needs Kiva lenders' support for the third time; his previous two loans were used to pay his son’s tuition fees. Now Vladimir’s son is in his last year of studying at Yerevan State University. He studies in a paid division of a newly opened department of Mass Media Research and Education, in the School of Directing. As previously mentioned, he is a talented and very artistic person, who really has great chances of becoming a very famous musician. He plays the reed pipe, and he has already participated in many concerts and competitions, and has won first place prizes. One can only admire young people of this sort, who were born to be artists. Nor Horizon greatly appreciates his talent and hopes that in a few years his name will become known world-wide. His father, Vladimir, will be happy to have Kiva’s support for the third time; this loan of 500,000 AMD (Armenian Drams) will help Vladimir’s family to face two very important challenges. Some of the loan will be used to pay the son’s tuition fees for the second semester, and the rest of the loan will be used to buy a new reed pipe for Vladimir’s son, since he needs a new instrument for an upcoming concert in which he will took part.

loans.use: to pay his son’s tuition fees and to buy a new reed pipe for his son, a musician.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias is a hardworking man with eight children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He distills waragi (a local brew) as his main source of income, and he also has a retail shop that earns him more income. He is challenged by a shortage of capital, which hinders the progress of his business. He hopes to educate all his children to higher levels of education and to develop his business. He needs a loan to rent a kisubi (banana) plantation, an ingredient used in making waragi.

loans.use: to rent a kisubi ( banana) plantation to obtain ingredients for making waragi (a local brew)

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en: Vicent, a 42-year-old married hard-working man with eight children, lives in Kasese, Uganda. He has been growing tomatoes, bananas and eggplant for 21 years, having started in agriculture by growing maize on a small scale, and later diversifying into commercial farming. His business hardships include price fluctuations and climate changes. His vision is to have a well-established farm and an educated family. Vicent is applying for the loan to buy banana tubers for planting to pay workers.

loans.use: to buy banana tubers for planting, and to pay  workers.

loans.name: Selvest

texts.en: Selvest is a 48-year-old married man with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. He runs a textile shop. He is faced with a challenge of market competition in his business. His monthly income does not cover all his family’s needs. All his life, he has wanted to have a decent home, which is why he is applying for a loan to buy cement and bricks and to pay for labor to build a house.

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks and to pay for labour to build a house.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard, a 46-year-old man, used his previous loan to buy land and expand his coffee plantation. Richard is a farmer growing primarily coffee and bananas. He also engages in fishing to obtain additional income to support his family. Richard wants to increase his crop production and produce more coffee. Richard is a hard-working person who is applying for a loan to buy coffee seedlings to add to his coffee plantation. Weather changes such as floods and drought are challenges adversely affecting his business output.

loans.use: to buy coffee seedlings to add to his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of sugar and rice and cartons of salt for resale.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a hardworking woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She runs a retail shop as her main source of income, and also practices agriculture where she raises cattle. She has a challenge of inadequate capital to fully fund her business. She has ambitions of raising money to build a personal permanent house.

She is requesting a loan to buy more salt, baking flour, soap and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy more salt, baking flour, soap and other items

loans.name: Wilberforce

texts.en:
Wilberforce is a 28-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in the purchasing and selling of a local brew (waragi) as his main source of income, and also earns a monthly income from farming. He was inspired by the need to carter for his family to start up that business. He faces a challenge of scarcity of resources to buy more local brew to sell. He has hopes of educating all his children and completing his house.  

He intends to use the loan to buy construction materials to complete his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to complete his house.

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vicent is a 41-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has been a farmer for the past 10 years, and he mainly grows bananas. He also gets an extra income from his goat rearing business.  He faces bad weather challenges and a scarcity of resources to buy more goats to sell. He has hopes of becoming a rich man and owning a big banana plantation. 
 
He hopes to use the loan to buy manure and seedlings for his banana plantation.

loans.use: to buy manure and seedlings for his banana plantation.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a scrap buyer from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is 49 years old, married and has seven grown-up children. Teresita has been in the scrap business for more than 11 years now. Her husband works as a fisherman. 

Teresita is asking to take out a loan to buy more recycled materials like plastic bottles, tin cans, and also a new net for fishing. Teresita believes that a loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials like plastic bottles, tin cans, and also a new fishing net for fishing

loans.name: Noel Ramiro

texts.es:
Noel es un hombre de 31 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 1 hijo varón de 8 años y una hija mujer de 1 año, y su negocio es la fabricación de puertas de metal.
Él es buen padre, emprendedor, independiente, dedicado a su trabajo, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Gran Poder’ un lugar caracterizado por el comercio en todas las áreas y por la festividad del señor Jesús del Gran Poder; que es tradicional, costumbrista y se celebra con una extraordinaria demostración folclórica en honor de la imagen (en lienzo) que se venera en el Templo del lugar. De clima frío y seco con una temperatura aproximada entre 8-21 grados centígrados durante todo el año, y a una altura de 3600 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Noel es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica a labores de casa y con sus hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela y la menor está aprendiendo a caminar. Viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la fabricación de puertas metálicas para casas, garajes, tipo cortina y también lisas, labor que aprendió de su padre para más luego independizarse y realizar su negocio. “aprendí este oficio desde muy niño como ayudante de mi padre, al independizarme ya contaba con clientes, eso me ayudo a estabilizar mi negocio…” comenta. Su sueño es comprar una casa para que sus hijos tengan su propia habitación, él desea ampiar su negocio mediante la compra de una máquina dobladora de planchas metálicas, que necesita para ofertar mayor variedad en diseño y acabado de puertas. Esta es su 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 11 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de manera independiente. Es por esos motivos que Noel solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina dobladora de planchas metálicas para ampliar la oferta de puertas metálicas y aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Noel is a 31-year-old man who lives with his life partner. He has an eight-year-old son and a one-year-old daughter. His business is making metal doors. He is a good father and is enterprising, independent, dedicated to his work, responsible and a hard worker.

His business is located in the 'Gran Poder" zone of the city, which is largely commercial in nature. It is also known for the festival of Señor Jesus del Gran Poder [Lord of Great Power], a traditional folkloric celebration with extravagant costumes and dance in honor of the venerated image (on canvas) in the local Temple. The climate there is cold and dry with temperatures ranging from 8 to 21 degrees centigrade [46 - 70 F] throughout the year. The altitude is 3600 meters (11,800') above sea level. 

Noel has a dark complexion, short black hair, dark eyes and is short and of average build. His mother tongue is Aymará which he speaks at home, but he uses Spanish for his business and for general purposes. He shares his life with his wife who takes care of their house and children. The elder child is in school and the younger one is learning to walk. They live in a rented house built of brick and concrete with a tin roof. It has running drinkable water, electricity and sewerage.

His occupation is making folding and smooth metal doors for houses and garages. He learned this trade from his father and later became independent and started his business. "I began to learn this trade when I was very young as my father's assistant. When I started off on my own I already had clients which helped me stabilize my business..." he states. 

His dream is to buy a house so that his children have their own home. He wants to expand his business by buying a sheet metal folding machine which he needs to offer a greater variety of designs and finishes on his doors. This is his first loan sequence with the institution in the 11 years he has had this business. This is why Noel is asking for a loan - to buy the sheet metal folding machine to expand his offerings of metal doors and to increase his sales.

loans.use: to buy a sheet metal folding machine, to expand his offerings of metal doors and increase his sales.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en: Teddy is a 27-year-old married woman living in Masindi, Uganda. She sells maize and beans in a produce store. She also earns a monthly salary to boost her earnings. She wants to buy land for farming; however, she is challenged by low pay and by competition. Teddy needs a loan to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Gildardo Alonso

texts.es:
Gildardo desea iniciar con el negocio de venta de mercancía en el municipio de Puerto Berrio, en su negocio planea vender accesorios para teléfonos celulares, los cuales son muy comercializados en dicho municipio.

El préstamo solicitado será para la compra de surtido en estos elementos.
texts.en: Gildardo wants to start a business selling merchandise in the municipality of Puerto Berrio, He plans to sell accessories for cell phones in his business. They are sold a lot in his municipality. This loan is to buy an assortment of these items.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of accessories for cell phones.

loans.name: Luisa Fernanda

texts.es:
Luisa Tiene un hijo pequeño (ver Foto) el cual adora con todas las fuerzas de su corazón y siempre está dispuesta a ofrecerle lo mejor que puede para su desarrollo y aprendizaje.

Desde hace mucho tiempo ha querido iniciar con un taller de confeccion para lo cual solicita un préstamo para comprar una maquina fileteadora e insumos de confección como tela e hilos.

Estos elementos le permitirán tener una actividad con la cual salir adelante y tener un buen progreso
texts.en: Luisa has a small boy (see picture,) whom she adores with all her heart and she is always willing to offer him the best she can for his development and education. For a long time, she has wanted to start a sewing shop, therefore she is asking for a loan to buy a sewing fillet machine and sewing materials such as fabric and threads. These items will allow her to have a job to get ahead and progress.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing fillet machine and sewing materials such as fabric and threads.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is a farmer. He is 64 years old, married and has ten grown-up children from Getafe, Bohol. 

Danilo has been in the farming business for so many years now. This time he would like to take a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. A loan will help him improve the productivity of his rice farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en: Bernardo is a 57-year-old man from Talibon, Bohol. He makes a living through his business raising hogs. Bernardo has been in the business for more than 10 years now. Bernardo is asking to take a loan to buy more feed and piglets to raise. Bernardo hopes of making his business a success in the future.

loans.use: to buy more feed and piglets to raise

loans.name: Gobunda

texts.en:
Gobunda is 27 years old, a differently-able man who lives with his parents and wife in Sonepur district, Odisha. He owns a retail shop where he mainly sells cereals such as rice, wheat, maize, wheat flour etc. He earns 4,000 INR per month from this business which is not sufficient for his monthly family expenses as this is the only source of income for his family. He is very hardworking and a responsible man. His father helps him in this business. 

Gobunda wants to expand his business by adding more varieties of rice and other cereals in his shop.

Gobunda has requested this loan to purchase different qualities of rice and other cereals in bulk for resale. He hopes to do well in his business. He is thankful to Kiva and its lenders for this great support.

loans.use: to purchase different qualities of rice and other cereals in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Manoj

texts.en:
Manoj is 35 years old, a differently-able man who lives with his wife and two children in Ganjam district of Odisha, India. He owns a small clinic and a very small medical store near his house. He completed DMTL course and started this clinic more than six years ago. He wants to purchase some medical equipment and also wants to add medicines in his shop so he can serve more patients.

Manoj has requested a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase medicines and some medical equipment for his clinic. He hopes to serve more patients. He has a dream to open a big clinic as there is not any other clinic in this area and people have to go 15 to 20 kilometers to see a doctor.

loans.use: to purchase medicines and some medical equipment for his clinic

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Chaila

texts.en:
Chaila is 33 years old, a differently-able man who lives with his father, mother, wife and a five-year-old child in a small village of Ganjam district, Odisha. His son is in school. He owns a grocery shop where he sells basic household items and earns 2,500 INR to 3,000 INR per month which is very little for family expenses. His father helps him in his business. His father is engaged in farming rice and vegetables but also does not earn sufficient money. Chaila is very responsible and hard-working man. 

Chaila has requested a loan of 15,000 INR to purchase rice, edible oil, sugar, spices and biscuits in bulk for resale. He hopes to do well in business. He is thankful to Kiva for this support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, edible oil, sugar, spices and biscuits in bulk for resale

loans.name: Maximu

texts.en:
Maximu is a new client to the institution. He is married with 4 children, 3 attend school. Maximu is a farmer who grows bananas from which he squeezes juice that he ferments to make the local gin. He thus deals in waragi (local gin) trade as his major source of income, a business he has done for 4 years. 

Maximu, however, has limited capital which affects his sales. Therefore, he decided to join Ugafode for financial assistance so as to be able to serve the available market and earn more income. Maximu applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX to buy more bananas to make more waragi for sale. Maximu hopes to expand his business using the loan extended to him and be able to meet all his financial needs without affecting his business.

loans.use: To buy bananas to make local gin

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of nine children from Talibon, Bohol. Caridad makes a living through her fishing and seaweed farming business. This has been her source of income for more than 20 years. 

Caridad is asking to take a loan to buy fishing nets and seaweed seedlings. A loan will help her improve her business as well as her income. Her future plans include the expansion of her business and sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and seaweed seedlings

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a farmer from Talibon, Bohol. She is 31 years old, married, and has four children. Catherine grows rice on her farm with her husband. 

Catherine is asking to take a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. A loan will help her improve the productivity of her farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a fish vendor from Talibon, Bohol. She is married and has seven children. Josephine has been in this business for more than 20 years. 

Josephine is asking to take a loan to buy more fish to sell to the market. A loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to the market

loans.name: Ma. Glenda

texts.en:
Ma. Glenda is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of four grown children. Ma. Glenda makes a living through her fishing and seaweed farming business. This has been her source of income for more than 20 years now. 

Ma. Glenda is asking to take a loan to buy fishing nets and seaweed seedlings. A loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and seaweed seedlings

loans.name: Luciano

texts.en:
Luciano is a 54-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has two grown children. Luciano earns a living through his sari-sari or retail store business. He has operated his store for more than 30 years now. 

Luciano, would like to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and bother everages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, condiments and cooking oil. This loan will enable Luciano to improve his stock, thus attracting more buyers in his store. In the future, Luciano dreams of making his business a success.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and other beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, condiments and cooking oil

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
Romana is 59 years old and married. She is from Talibon, Bohol. Romana operates a sari-sari store, which she has been doing for more than 30 years.

Romana requested a loan, which she will use to buy more groceries such as canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, bread, biscuits, condiments, and cooking oil. This loan will enable Romana to improve her stocks thus attracting more buyers to her store. In the future, she hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, soda.  beverages, soap, toiletries, bread, biscuits, condiments, and cooking oil

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn is a 23-year-old married woman and a mother of a 5-year-old child. Juvelyn makes a living through her fishing business. This has been her source of income for more than 3 years. 

Juvelyn is asking to take a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other inputs needed for her business.  A loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other tools

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is a 49-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. Alberta earns a living through her sari-sari or retail store business. She has operated her store for more than 30 years. 

Alberta would like to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and other beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, condiments and cooking oil. This loan will enable Alberta to improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers to her store. 

In the future, Alberta dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and other beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, condiments and cooking oil

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is a farmer from Talibon, Bohol. He is 54 years old, married, and has seven children. Rogelio grows rice on his farm. 

Rogelio is asking to take a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. A loan will help him improve the productivity of his farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a farmer from Talibon, Bohol. She is 45 years old, married, and has four children. Merlinda grows rice on her farm with her husband. 

Merlinda is asking to take a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. A loan will help her improve the productivity of her farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Jeto

texts.en:
Jeto is a 38-year-old, married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has three children. 

Jeto earns a living through his sari-sari or retail store business. He has operated his store for more than a year now. He is also a rice farmer. 

Jeto, would like to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, bread, biscuits, condiments, and cooking oil. This loan will enable him to improve his stocks, thus attracting more buyers in his store. 

In the future, Jeto dreams of making his business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Yasira

texts.es:
Yasira es una mujer la cual se desempeña como madre amorosa y como agricultora, en vista de que los ingresos no son suficientes para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, desea comenzar con una actividad que realizara en los ratos libres que le quedan como ama de casa y es la cría y venta de, pollos con los que intenta mejorar las condición es de vida de su familia, está a cargo de algunos gastos en su hogar con su esposo por lo que no le queda mucho capital para invertir en su negocio. 

Es por esta razón que requiere un crédito para la compra de pollos y alimento para los mismos con los que podrá mejorar sus ventas e impulsar esta actividad, teniendo más activas en su micro negocio y haciendo más atractivo a la vista de los clientes pues tendrá más animales para ofertar.

Su principal sueño es poder generar buenos ingresos para no ver pasar a su familia ninguna necesidad pues es algo que vivió y que lo afecto de gran manera por esta razón trabaja incansablemente por sus hijos y su esposo.

Apoya a una campesina del campo Colombiano con grandes sueños para su familia!
texts.en: Yasira is a woman who functions as a loving mother and as a farmer. Given that her income is not sufficient to cover the costs of her household, she wants to start a business that she will do in her free time that she has as a housewife. it is raising and selling chickens with the intention of improving her family's living conditions. She is responsible along with her husband for some of the household expenses so she doesn't have a lot of capital to invest in her business. It is for this reason that she needs a loan to buy chickens and food for them with which to improve her sales and give boost to her business, putting more activities in her micro-business and making it more attractive to clients as she has more animals to offer. Her main dream is to be able to generate good income to see that her family does not go without and it is something she has lived with and affected her in a profound way. For this reason she works ceaselessly for her children and husband. Support this farmer from the countryside of Colombia with her big dreams for her family.

loans.use: to buy chickens and food for them.

loans.name: Luz Mary

texts.es:
Luz se ha dedicado por mucho tiempo a la comercialización de yuca y ñame en el municipio de Sahagun con el ánimo de sostener y sacar adelante su familia con la dignidad y coraje que caracteriza a una madre.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de inventario de ñame y de yuca, además desea realizar algunas mejoras locativas al lugar donde almacena estos productos.

Ayuda a luz a encontrar el camino correcto para progresar y ser muy prospera!
texts.en: Luz has worked for a very long time selling yuca and yams in the town of Sahagun with the desire to sustain and succeed with her family with the dignity and the courage that characterizes a mother. She is seeking a loan to purchase an inventory of yams and yuca. Moreover, she wants to complete some improvements to the place where she stores these products. Please help Luz to find the correct path to progress and to become very prosperous!

loans.use: to purchase an inventory of yams and yuca.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 54 years old, married, and has 9 children.  She is from Talibon, Bohol. 

Maria earns a living through her sari-sari or retail store business. She has operated her store for more than 3 years now. 

Maria, would like to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, condiments and cooking oil. 

This loan will help Maria increase her inventory thus attracting more buyers to her store. 

In the future, Maria dreams of making her business more stable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, condiments and cooking oil

loans.name: Nini Angeli

texts.es:
Nini de 18 años de edad, se ha ganado el cariño de todos sus vecinos por su amabilidad y buen sentido del humor. 

Ama su familia, la cual es el motor principal para luchar cada día y generar el sustento para sobrevivir. 

Aunque no contaba con recursos para iniciar su negocio, esto no fue impedimento para cumplir su sueño de convertirse en comerciante, con un pequeño capital, esta mujer inició con un negocio de tienda de abarrotes.

Sus sueños no paran, por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de estanterías para ubicar sus productos y hacerlos más visibles y atractivos a sus clientes, además comprara surtido de productos de la canasta familiar para abastecer su negocio. 

Espera poder mejorar su condición económica, poder tener una vida sin preocupaciones monetarias y garantizarle a su hija (Ver Foto) un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Nini is 18 years old, she has won the affection of all of her neighbours due to her kindness and good sense of humour.

She loves her family, which is the main reason to fight every day to provide support to survive.

Although she did not have the resources to start her business, this was not an impediment to fulfil her dreams of becoming a businesswoman, with a small capital, this woman started a grocery store business.

Her dreams do not stop, for this reason she finds herself asking for a loan which she will invest in the purchase of shelves to hold her products and make them more visible and attractive to her clients, also she will buy an assortment of family shopping basket products to stock her business.

She hopes to be able to improve her economic situation, to be able to have a life without monetary concerns and to guarantee her daughter (see photo) a better future.

loans.use: to purchase shelving, also she will buy an assortment of family shopping basket products to stock her business

loans.name: Mayramo

texts.ru: Майрамо женщина 45 лет, замужем, мать - героиня пятерых детей. На протяжение 20 лет Майрамо занимается животноводством. Она закончила 9 классов школы и не поступила в высшее учебное заведение, потому что у ее семьи не было средств для оплаты университета. Сейчас у нее большой участок земли, на котором она ухаживает за шестью коровами и тремя баранами. Каждое утро Майрамо сама доит коров и относит молоко на рынок для продажи. Майрамо хочет увеличить поголовье своего скота, но у нее в настоящее время нет полной суммы денег. Поэтому она обратилась в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой .Майрамо надеется, что МДО Арвванд откликнется на ее просьбу и выделит нужную ей сумму. Заранее благодарит за доверие.
texts.en: Mayramo is a 45-year-old woman and a mother-hero of five children. Mayramo has been involved in animal husbandry for 20 years. She completed 9 school grades and did not go to a university because her family did not have money to pay for the tuition. Now she has a large plot of land, where she takes care of six cows and three sheep. Mayramo milks the cows every morning and takes milk to a market for sale. Mayramo wants to increase her livestock headcount, but currently does not have enough money. This is why she requested financial support from MDO Arvand. Mayramo hopes that MDO Arvand will respond to her request and provide her with the necessary sum of money. She is grateful for the trust in advance.

loans.use: to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Armelita

texts.en:
Armelita is a 43-year-old married woman and has three children. She is from Talibon, Bohol. Armelita earns a living through her sari-sari or retail store business. She has operated her store for more than four years. 

Armelita would like to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and other beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, condiments and cooking oil. This loan will enable Armelita to improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers to her store. 

In the future, Armelita dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and other beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, condiments and cooking oil

loans.name: Rolly Boy

texts.en:
Rolly Boy is a fisherman from Bien Unido, Bohol. He has been in the fishing business for more than 2 years now. This is his source of income. 

Rolly Boy is asking to take a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other necessary items. 

A loan will help him improve his catch thus giving him more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other necessary items

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
Johna is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of a 2 year old child.  She is  from Getafe, Bohol. 

She is engaged in a hog raising business for several years now. This is her source of income. 

Johna would like to take a loan to buy piglets to raise and animal feed. 

A loan will help her improve the productivity of her pig raising business.  

Johna dreams of expanding her business in the future in order to generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is a 58-year-old married woman and a mother of three grown up children. Celsa lives in Talibon, Bohol. 

Celsa earns a living through a food vending business. She sells home cooked foods to the people in her area. 

Celsa is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, cooking oil, condiments, and rice. 

A loan will allow her to cook more meals and sell more to her customers. 

In the future, Celsa hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, cooking oil, condiments, and rice

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is a 61-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has five children. 

Felix earns a living through his sari-sari or retail store business. He has operated his store for more than 11 years now. 

Felix, would like to take a loan to buy more inventory to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, condiments and cooking oil. 

This loan will enable Felix in improving his inventory thus attracting more buyers to his store. 

In the future, Felix dreams of making his business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more inventory to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, condiments and cooking oil

loans.name: Merasol

texts.en:
Merasol is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. 

Merasol makes a living through a fishing business. This has been her source of income for more than 11 years now. 

Merasol is asking to take a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other necessary items.  

A loan will help her improve her business and her income.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other necessary items

loans.name: Gerie

texts.en:
Gerie is a farmer from Talibon, Bohol. He is 33 years old, married, and has 4 children. 

Gerie has been growing rice in his farm for several years now. 

Gerie is asking to take a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. 

A loan will help him improve the productivity of his farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Marcinita

texts.en:
Marcinita is a farmer from Getafe, Bohol. She is married and has a three year old child. Her husband works as a welder. 

Marcinita grows rice in her farm. She also earns an additional income through food vending. 

Marcinita is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the farm and additional ingredients like flour, sugar, cooking oil and butter for her food vending business. 

A loan would be a great help for Marcinita in improving her businesses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm and additional ingredients like flour, sugar, cooking oil, and butter

loans.name: Casimera

texts.en:
Casimera is a married woman and a mother of 4 children.

Casimera makes a living through a fishing business with her husband . This has been her source of income for more than 11 years now. 

Casimera is asking to take a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items.  

A loan will help her improve her business and her income.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other items

loans.name: Crescencio

texts.en:
Crescencio is a 44-year-old fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He is married and has 7 children. 

He has been in the fishing business for more than 11 years now. This is his source of income. 

Crescencio is asking to take a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other necessary items. 

A loan will help him improve his catch thus giving him more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other necessary items

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
Jason is a 24-year-old tricycle driver from Talibon, Bohol. 

He has been in the business for more than 2 years now. This is the source of his income.
